page.title: IB Biology HL (First Exams 2009): A Complete Study Guide

revision.comment: Created first page of study guide, along with links to each topic.
revision.text:
== Preface ==
This book has been created as a study guide for IB students in the Biology Higher Level course. However, this resource may prove useful for Standard Level Biology students. The Higher Level material is clearly marked.
The book has been divided into syllabus topics and outcomes to aid revision.
== Table of Contents ==
=== Core Material ===
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Topic 1: Statistical Analysis|Topic 1: Statistical Analysis]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Topic 2: Cells|Topic 2: Cells]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Topic 3: Chemical Elements and Water|Topic 3: Chemical Elements and Water]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Topic 4: Genetics|Topic 4: Genetics]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Topic 5: Ecology and Evolution|Topic 5: Ecology and Evolution]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Topic 6: Human Health and Physiology|Topic 6: Human Health and Physiology]]
=== Additional Higher Level Material ===
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Topic 7: Nucleic Acids and Proteins|Topic 7: Nucleic Acids and Proteins]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Topic 8: Cell Respiration and Photosynthesis|Topic 8: Cell Respiration and Photosynthesis]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Topic 9: Plant Science|Topic 9: Plant Science]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Topic 10: Genetics|Topic 10: Genetics]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Topic 11: Human Health and Physiology|Topic 11: Human Health and Physiology]]
=== Options SL ===
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Option A: Human Nutrition and Health|Option A: Human Nutrition and Health]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Option B: Physiology of Exercise|Option B: Physiology of Exercise]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Option C: Cells and Energy|Option C: Cells and Energy]]
=== Options SL and HL ===
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Option D: Evolution|Option D: Evolution]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Option E: Neurobiology and Behaviour|Option E: Neurobiology and Behaviour]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Option F: Microbes and Biotechnology|Option F: Microbes and Biotechnology]]
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Option G: Ecology and Conservation|Option G: Ecology and Conservation]]
=== Options HL ===
[[{{FULLBOOKNAME}}/Option H: Further Human Physiology|Option H: Further Human Physiology]]
#REDIRECT [[wikiversity:Bicycle turn signal]]

=Problem Statement = The challenge was to design a pet feeder that would allow the owner to limit a pet's access to food and control the quantity of food dispensed at a given time (HS).
= Conceive = ===Why=== The first step in any project needs to begin with defining a solid and concise statement. As our groups were first assigned [https://en.wikiversity.org/wiki/User:Merielle213 Heidi Schultz] had already had an idea of what she wanted to design. Even with a preliminary design [https://en.wikiversity.org/wiki/User:MTomaselli I] knew that there were still a plethora of questions and concerns that needed to be addressed. The first and foremost, which I knew from previous experience, was establishing a client base. Knowing exactly what our customer market was would allow us to gear our design specifically for who we wanted to sell to. For example, I brought up the point that whatever our final product was going to be it needed to be of an appropriate size because having pets I knew that I wouldn't want another bulk item sitting in my living room. The conceive process in any project, especially a group project, is ultimately the most important task of them all. It not only drives a common agreement in moving forward but it is the decision that I refer back to every time there's a question regarding what, specifically, I need to accomplish (MT).
===Original Inspiration=== * [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YejpfCDh4Lc Timed Pet food Dispenser] * [http://www.instructables.com/id/Arduino-controled-dog-foodtreat-dispenser/ Screw/rotating Feeder Inspiration] *[http://www.instructables.com/id/RFID-pet-feeder/ RFID-triggered feeder] * [[File:Heidi's Obese cat.jpg|Heidi's Obese Cat]]
=Design=
===Requirements=== *relatively small *allow access to food relatively quickly when approached *hide food relatively quickly if the wrong pet approached *easy to clean *buildable using materials found in the HCC Engineering Lab *dispense food in 1/4 cup increments *act in response to a pet wearing or implanted with an RFID chip approaching the apparatus (HS).
===Design Alternatives=== *bowl rotator that would hide 3 bowls and make one accessible at all times- servos we had to work with were not powerful enough to turn a platform holding four bowls, and using a DC motor would have required adding sensors and became unnecessarily complicated. *"screw" feeder to dispense food, rather than the final rotating food dispenser. The screw feeder would have been more complicated to measure the quantity of food, though it may have used less torque to control.
'''Other alternatives considered included:''' * Automatically dispensed vs. owner-measured food * Magnet vs. RFID control * Food inside a transparent box with RFID triggered door-lock vs. food bowl inside containment. * 3D-printed housing vs. handmade * Battery vs. corded power supply (HS).
===Initial Design=== *cylindrical or rectangular housing to hold pet food *"screw/twisting" style dispenser below it. *Food from dispenser fed through a tube to a bowl on a rotating platform * When a pet approached, an arduino received the signal from an RFID reader and instructed the appropriate bowl to rotate out of a covered compartment and into the open for access, then food would be dispensed into the bowl. *Then, the arduino instructed the food dipenser to release the appropriate number of 1/4 cup food increments into the bowl. *The RFID reader would read microchips that were either implanted under the pet's skin or worn on a collar.
===Prototypes Needed=== Prototype out of available materials scaled for a small dog or cat Includes: *Arduino for control *9 volt battery for power *servos for movement *Hosing from wood or plastic
The next step would be to create an improved prototype out of superior materials , taking into consideration any feedback or discoveries from Prototype 1 and making appropriate changes. Once this prototype has been perfected we create scaled up versions in sizes appropriate for larger pets. The larger versions may need increased torque from a servo and possibly increased power to support the torque-providing device (HS).
===Modeling and simulation=== Each piece of the physical unit was designed in [http://www.sketchup.com/?gclid=CLiC97vUvb0CFWuhOgodq1YAAg Sketchup2014] prior to prototyping. This allowed for detailed evaluation of specifications and potential issues prior to creation. I believe this led to a smoother constructions process (HS). The file can be reached [https://www.dropbox.com/sh/i5hj517087f35wr/uDpY-em4Nb here]
<gallery>
File:Pet Food Dispenser.png|Pet Food Storage and Dispenser File:Bowl housing without components - to illustrate lid and groove design.png|Bowl housing without components - to illustrate lid/ groove design File:Feeder box with gear components.png|Feeder box with gear components </gallery> (HS)
===Aesthetics and human factors===
We attempted to keep the entire apparatus as small in overall size as possible. It takes up a floor space of 12"x6" and a wall space of approximately 6" x 18-24".
The prototype is not nearly as attractive as the final product ought to be. Ideally we would use a smooth, attractive plastic for most of the pieces to improve aesthetic value and make cleaning the unit easy. The final product will also not allow easy access to the moving, electrical, and mechanical components - lids and covers will be secured with screws.
==Final Design==
*3x6x12 inch box with a groove 1/8 inch from the top edge for the lid to slide in * right side is slightly larger to allow for a piece of rack gear to protrude into the compartment and link with the gear assembly and still be able to retract completely to open * mounts for the servo (see the below image) * converted the measurements to inches and used those illustrated in the image below. <gallery> File:Futabaspecs.png|Getting servo specs and converting to inches File:Feeder box.png|Feeder box with gear assembly </gallery>
* box lid slides 5.75 inches but the box was only 3 inches high and the servo that turns the gears can only turn 180 degrees. So, any gear that fits inside the box would not have a large enough diameter to have a circumference (that moves the lid) large enough. *Gears 0.9 and 2.25 inches in diameter create the proper turning distance of 5.75 inches when the servo turns them '''105.4 degrees'''.
*Gear Creation: #Sketchup plugin that allows for relatively easy gear creation can be downloaded at ||http://www.ohyeahcad.com/download/%7C%7C. # this plugin only works in Sketchup 8 or earlier versions, downloadable at ||http://google-sketchup-pro.en.softonic.com%7C%7C. # After downloading both of these files the plugin .rbz file must be manually placed into the Google > Sketchup8 > plugins folder. The gear function is found under menu item Draw > Involute Gear. #I left the pressure angle at 20 degrees (If the gear teeth are not perfectly square, that is, they are slightly rounded or cut off at an angle, the pressure angle is the angle between the vertical side of the tooth and the line that angles away from it to the horizontal side of the tooth). #The teeth and pitch radius determine whether the teeth of two gears fit together. Pitch radius 0.45 and 1.125 inches. 12 and 30 gear teeth respectively. # teeth:gear ratio must be the same for each gear (See images below). <gallery> File:Rack for feeder box.png|Rack gear on underside of feeder box lid File:FeederBoxGears.png|Gears to open feeder box lid </gallery> (HS)
The tail end of this semester saw this project passed on to another group which consisted of Carlos Fernandez, Kevin Szostak, Arien Motaher, Asad Gillani,and Eldrick Kinmakon. Our group was able to push the project forward by completing initial design concepts created by the previous group,as well as address concerns that were to be revisited later by the prior group.
Components that were brought to fruition at this point of the project include: *3D printed wheel which holds and dispenses food *Mountable container to release food to wheel
[[File:3d Printed Component.JPG|thumb|3d Printed Component]]
=Implement= Currently working on the Implement phase of the project, we still have to map out all of the potential dilemmas we face with the project. <u>'''All files and code prepared for this project can be found [https://www.dropbox.com/sh/i5hj517087f35wr/uDpY-em4Nb here].'''</u>
During the implement phase of the project, the second group was able to take the completed components of the project and attempt to assemble them so as to bring the physical aspect to fruition. A New physical unit was completed utilizing wood, with openings created to affix the following: * Servo motors * Arduino Unit * Food Container
Bolts were inserted into the 3d printed Wheel to help stabilize the unit during motion. The unit was sanded down so that it would pose no risk to any of the team members that worked on it, or any animal that my approach it should it be used. In order to attract any animal that may not know what it was, the unit was spray painted red so as to draw attention.
[[File:Complete Assembly.JPG|thumb|Complete Assembly]]
=Operate=
*[[BDolge/AutomaticPetFeeder/CDIO/Minimal_Conceive|Conceive]] CDIO *[[BDolge/AutomaticPetFeeder/CDIO/Minimal_Design|Design]] CDIO *[[BDolge/AutomaticPetFeeder/CDIO/Minimal_Implement|Implement]] CDIO *[[BDolge/AutomaticPetFeeder/CDIO/Minimal_Operation|Operate]] CDIO *

{{ambox|type=content|text='''Was this page [[Wikibooks:Deletion policy#Speedy deletions|created by accident or as a test?]]''' Please clarify what the intentions of this page are on the [[{{TALKPAGENAME}}|discussion page]]. The page might be able to remain at [[WB:WIW|Wikibooks]] after 7 days when further development is likely.
''Please consider notifying the author(s) with {{tlxs|Query notice|{{FULLPAGENAME}}|~~~~}} {{ #if: This page should be part of a book but there is no book called BDolge. If it should be part of a user's user space then it should be mentioned that Wikibooks is not a hosting service. Generally books should be developed in the main space where they are accessible and editable by anybody. | *''Additional comments: This page should be part of a book but there is no book called BDolge. If it should be part of a user's user space then it should be mentioned that Wikibooks is not a hosting service. Generally books should be developed in the main space where they are accessible and editable by anybody.'' }} }}{{#ifeq:no|yes|| [[Category:{{#ifexpr:{{lastedit}} >= 7|Candidates for speedy deletion|Queried pages}}|{{SUBPAGENAME}}]]}} ==Problem Statement== The challenge was to design a pet feeder that would allow the owner to limit a pet's access to food and control the quantity of food dispensed at a given time. ==The Design Process== =====Requirements for each element or component derived from system level goals and requirements===== The pet food bowl housing needed to be relatively small, allow access to food relatively quickly when approached, and hide food relatively quickly if the wrong pet approached. It also needed to be easy to clean and buildable using materials found in the HCC Engineering Lab. The food "hopper" which holds the bulk food and dispenses it at the appropriate time also needed to take up as little space as possible, in conjunction with the bowl housing. It was decided that it should dispense food in 1/4 cup increments. It also had to be built out of materials in the Engineering lab. Both of these would be required to act in response to a pet wearing or implanted with an RFID chip approaching the apparatus. =====Alternatives in design===== The group initially considered using a bowl rotator that would hide 3 bowls and make one accessible at all times. This idea was set aside when it became clear that the servos we had to work with were not powerful enough to turn a platform holding four bowls, and using a DC motor would have required adding sensors and became unnecessarily complicated. It also used a "screw" feeder to dispense food, rather than the final rotating food dispenser. The screw feeder would have been more complicated to measure the quantity of food, though it may have used less torque to control. =====The initial design===== The initial design consisted of a cylindrical or rectangular housing to hold pet food, with a rotating dispenser below it. Food from that dispenser was fed through a tube to the bowl housing. The bowl sat in the forward compartment and the components that operate it in the rear compartment. When a pet approached, an arduino received the signal from an RFID reader and instructed the bowl housing to retract its lid. Then, the arduino instructed the food dipenser to release the appropriate number of 1/4 cup food increments into the bowl. File:Pet Food Dispenser.png|Pet Food Storage and Dispenser File:Bowl housing without components - to illustrate lid and groove design.png|Bowl housing without components - to illustrate lid/ groove design File:Feeder box with gear components.png|Feeder box with gear components The sketchup file containing these designs can be found [https://www.dropbox.com/sh/i5hj517087f35wr/uDpY-em4Nb here]. =====Experiment prototypes and tests need for design===== ==Modeling, simulation and test== ==Multi-Objective Design (DFX)== =====Performance, life cycle cost and value===== =====Aesthetics and human factors===== =====Implementation, verification, test and environmental sustainability===== =====Operations===== =====Maintainability, reliability, and safety===== =====Robustness, evolution, product improvement and retirement===== ==Poster== ==Next Steps==

CONCEIVING AND ENGINEERING SYSTEMS
==Idea==
Make a bicycle turn signal out of LEDs that can be mounted on almost any bike and that gives the user control of the turn signal without losing the ability to also use there arm as a turn signal.
==Problem Statement== · Each year, more than 500,000 people go to the emergency room for bicycle injuries in the USA. More than 700 people die from those injuries.
· Children 15 years and younger are the biggest risk.
· Bicycle injuries and deaths cost $8 billion each year.
·Adolescents/Young people(ages 15-24) and adults aged 45 and older have the highest death rates.
·Males are more likely to get injured than females.
·Most of all bicycle deaths happen in urban areas and non-intersection areas.
==Setting System Goals and Requirements== ===Market/Customer needs===
* Competitive Bike Riders * Leisurely Bike Riders * Supply a proactive safety mechanism to a market that lends to $8 billion in annual cost resulting from injury and death. By implementing an easily recognizable safety system, it is not only the biker community that benefits, but automobile operators, and local government- with benefits trickling down to taxpayers as well.
===Factors that set the context of the requirements===
* Customer Needs (MT) * Cost of Materials (MT) * Time/Duration of Project (MT) * Aesthetics (MT) * Practicality (MT) * Marketability (MT) * Available Resources (MT)
=====Enterprise goals and capabilities=====
* Simplicity * Cost effectiveness * Employ a product that can easily be integrated in any enterprise scenario that would call for such an item.
=====Competitors and benchmarking information=====
=====Ethical, social, environmental, legal and regulatory influences=====
===System goals and requirements=== =====Initial target goals (based on needs, opportunities and other influences)===== =====System performance metrics=====
==Defining Function, Concept and Architecture== ===Necessary system functions===
* Provide luminance that projects a minimum of 10ft * components mounted upon a surface area visible from a minimum of 10ft away * LED placement distinguishable as arrows * Ability to indicate movement of two directions (left and right)
===System concepts===
===Trade-offs among concepts===
===High level architectural form and structure=== ===The decomposition of form into subsystems, assignment of functions to subsystems, and definition of interfaces===
==Modeling of System and Ensuring Goals Can Be Met== ===Appropriate models of technical performance=== ===The plan of implementation and operations=== ===Trade-offs among various goals and functions===
==Development Project Management== ===Project cost and schedule===
* Additional Costs (not originally provided by class) * $7.50 - set of LED Holders * $7.95 - 25 Pack of LED * TBD - Cost of 3D printed housing
===Estimation and allocation of resources=== ===Risks and alternatives=== *Users could depend on using general hand signals *Risk of limited sight range
==Poster== ==Next Steps==

revision.text: I created this Wikibook to help IB students. I will add substantially to this over the next few weeks (maybe months). I am trying to keep this as concise as possible. [[User:CatanOverlord|CatanOverlord]] ([[User talk:CatanOverlord|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/CatanOverlord|contribs]]) 18:45, 24 March 2014 (UTC)

This book is about the ''Math Builder'' tool in Microsoft Word versions 2007 and higher. It also applies to Microsoft PowerPoint 2010 and higher. Note that this is a different tool than the legacy tool ''Equation editior 3.0'' and ''Mathtype''.
Typesetting mathematics on a computer has always been a challenge. The mathematical community almost universally accepts a typesetting language called LaTeX. ''Math Builder'' is a much easier to use tool that has less functionality than [[Wikipedia: LaTeX|LaTeX]] but more than typical document processing. Microsoft call this hybrid language the ''Office Math Markup Language'', or OMML for short. It is an appropriate tool for: *Typing any document whose focus is not itself mathematics. *Typing a short mathematics document quickly. *A stepping stone between word processing (MS Word) and typesetting (LaTeX) Note that Math Builder does not perform any mathematics: it is a tool for displaying it.
== Pros and Cons == '''Pros:''' *Math Builder is [[Wikipedia: WYSIWYG|WYSIWYG]]: after typing an equation you see immediately what it looks like. *It's easy to get started: it's already built in to Microsoft Word. Common symbols have point-and-click icons. *It's easy to use: Common symbols have keyboard shortcuts so that a veteran user need not use a mouse at all. *Nearly all symbols use the same commands as LaTeX. *The format used is non-proprietary and given in Unicode Technical Note #28.
'''Cons:''' *Some uncommon symbols are not listed in the menu and require knowing the keyboard shortcut. Typically this is the LaTeX code for the symbol. *There are differences between Math Builder and LaTeX code: advanced functionality that requires more than just a symbol tend to follow the same flavor but have slightly different syntax. Math Builder code tends to be shorter than LaTeX code and disappears upon completion to the WYSIWYG output. Examples here are matrices, multiple aligned equations, and binomial coefficients. *No LaTeX typesetting tools such as labels and references are implemented. *No highly advanced LaTeX tools such as graphing, commutative diagrams, or geometric shapes are implemented. *Students studying mathematics might not be motivated to learn LaTeX because they might be able to get by with ''Equation Builder'' in Word to satisfy the vast majority of their needs. However, when such a student reaches the limits, unlike LaTeX there is absolutely no recourse to expand the program to satisfy it.
== Inserting an equation == Microsoft Word has two different typing environments: text and math. To obtain the math environment, click on "Equation" on the "Insert" ribbon. The keyboard shortcut is "alt"+ "=". Everything you type in this environment is considered math: all automatic formatting of text is disabled. To exit the math environment, click on any text outside the math environment. One easy way to do this is by pressing the right arrow key.
== Common Mathematics == === Fractions === There are multiple ways to display a fraction. The default is vertically aligned as illustrated below. Obtain this by typing the fraction and pressing space: '''1/2'''
<MATH>\frac{1}{2}</MATH>
=== Parenthesis, brackets, and braces === Grouping symbols will automatically size to the appropriate size. These symbols include "(), {}, [], ||". For instance, the expression below can be obtained with '''(1/2(x+1))''':
<MATH>\left (\frac{1}{2}(x+1)\right )</MATH>
(Be careful to press space after the "2" to render the fraction, otherwise Word might put "x+1" in the denominator.) === Exponents and subscripts === Exponents can be obtained by using "^" and subscripts by "_". The monomial below can be obtained by typing '''x_2^5''' or '''x^5_2''' and pressing space.
<MATH>x_2^5</MATH>
=== Symbols: <MATH>\neq, \leq, \subseteq, \vee, \rightarrow, \Rightarrow </MATH> etc === These are all common symbols. The easiest thing to do would be to find a LaTeX reference sheet. A few of those symbols are shown here: {| class = "wikitable" |code |output |- |\neq |<MATH>\neq</MATH> |- |\leq or <= |<MATH>\leq</MATH> |- |\subseteq |<MATH>\subseteq</MATH> |- |\vee |<MATH>\vee</MATH> |- |\rightarrow |<MATH>\rightarrow</MATH> |- |\Rightarrow |<MATH>\Rightarrow</MATH> |}
=== Greek, Script, and Fraktur letters === The math environment implements 3 fronts in addition to the default. *Greek letters can be obtained by typing a "\" followed by the name of symbol. Capitalizing it creates a capital letter. '''\delta \Delta''' produces <MATH>\delta \Delta</MATH> *Script letters can be obtained by typing "\" followed by "script" followed by the letter. '''\scriptd \scriptD''' produces <MATH>\mathcal{d} \mathcal{D}</MATH> *Fraktur letters can be obtained by typing "\" followed by "fraktur" followed by the letter. Fraktur does not have capitals. '''\frakd''' prodouces <MATH>\mathfrak{d}</MATH>
=== Blackboard Bold letters === Blackboard bold letters can be obtained by typing "\" followed by "double" followed by the letter. '''\doubled \doubleD''' produces <MATH>\mathbb{d} \mathbb{D}</MATH>
=== Matrices === Matrices are obtained with the "\matrix" symbol. Use parenthesis to start and end the matrix. Use "@" to separate rows, and "&" to separate columns. The matrix below can be created by typing '''[\matrix(1&2&3@4&5&6)]'''.
<MATH>\begin{bmatrix} 1&2&3\\4&5&6\end{bmatrix}</MATH>
=== Multiple Aligned Equations === Aligning equations can be obtained with the "eqarray" symbol. Use parenthesis to stat and end the matrix. Use "@" to separate equations. Use "&" to specify alignment and whitespace. The first "&" and then every other occurrence is alignment. The second and then every other occurrence is white space. The equations below can be obtained by typing the following text: <source lang="latex">\eqarray(2&x+&3&y=5@&x+&&y=7)</source>
<MATH>\begin{align}2&x+&3&y=5\\&x+&&y=7\end{align}</MATH>
(The math environment here seems to be adding excess space between the alignments that doesn't occur in Word)
== Inline versus Display == Equations have two forms. '''Inline''' specifies that the equation is to be in line with text. This affects a few expressions to make them appear smaller. For instance fractions will use a smaller font. Summations and integrals will place the endpoints to the right of the symbol instead of below it. '''Display''' specifies to use as much space as needed. Display mode equations must appear on their own line.
== Modifying and creating shortcuts == Everything in Math Builder requires special symbols that the computer knows how to interpret. These symbols are constructed with all the commands starting with "\" as illustrated in the above sections. This is implemented via ''math autocorrect'' which you can modify. For instance, you might like to use \ra instead of \rightarrow. You can do this by adding the command to the ''math autocorrect'' directory.

== Welcome! ==
[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Herman darman!
[[File:Crystal Clear app kedit.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for [[WB:AGF|collaborative]] development of free [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].''' You do not need technical skills to [[Using Wikibooks|contribute]]. You can [[WB:BOLD|easily change most books]]. Please [[WB:CHAT|introduce yourself]], and let us know what [[WB:PROJECTS|interests you]]. If you already contribute at other Wikimedia projects, our [[Wikibooks:Wikibooks for Wikimedians|Wikimedia Orientation]] should quickly get you started.
(Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?)
[[File:Icon apps query.svg|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Getting help'''
* Read the [[Using Wikibooks]] book for a friendly introduction to the project, or our [[Help:Contents|help pages]] for more information. * You can get friendly help from the community in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]] or our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * Upload freely licensed files to [[commons:Wikimedia Commons|Wikimedia Commons]]. You may [[WB:RFP|request permission]] to upload [[w:fair use|fair use]] files locally. Please include author and source {{tl|information}} and a {{nowrap|{{tl|non-free use rationale}}}} for [[WB:FU|non-free]] files.
[[File:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* You can [[WB:REVERT|restore]] a previously saved version. * Pages should follow the [[WB:NP|'''Book Title/Chapter Title''']] naming convention. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (is available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To request a page be deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason''}} to the top of the page. * Was a page you made deleted? Please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
[[File:Transmission icon.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[WB:ES|the edit summary]] and [[WB:PREVIEW|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[WB:TALK|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
Thanks, --[[User:Xania|ЗAНИA]] [[Image:Flag_of_Estonia.svg|15px]][[User talk:Xania|talk]] 22:12, 24 March 2014 (UTC)

revision.comment: /* Dotting the t's and crossing the i's */
revision.text:
Also, congrats everybody on a great, collaborative product! I'm proud of what we've accomplished in two weeks! [[User:RedheadRachel|RedheadRachel]] ([[User talk:RedheadRachel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/RedheadRachel|contribs]]) 16:13, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
==Dotting the t's and crossing the i's== Hey, now more than ever I just wanted to suggest cleaning up what we've already got. We have a ton of great info already, and I feel we've more than covered the appropriate areas, and rather than just throwing in more bits and bobs I'd say perfecting what we do should be a priority. Generally just bringing formatting and such in line throughout the page, correcting any spelling or grammar errors, really just polishing what we've got till it's good an' shiny and professional! Hope that's not a problem George? ;D [[User:Flailkerrin|Flailkerrin]] ([[User talk:Flailkerrin|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Flailkerrin|contribs]]) 15:56, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
Yeah I think its a good idea just to clean things up a bit because we have loads of information and I think we have covered pretty much everything. Adding some pictures is a good touch and maybe linking things to other pages ect. And also making sure all the grammar and spelling is correct. Do we have until the end of the day to do all of this yeah? [[User:Heyrach|Heyrach]] ([[User talk:Heyrach|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Heyrach|contribs]]) 16:10, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
I don't know, timewise. I just know that Kelly.marvel and I have been doing some serious polishing/editing for consistency (like the 'always-on' stuff) as well as for content. If you others are confident in your formatting skills (I'm not so confident in mine), have at it! [[User:RedheadRachel|RedheadRachel]] ([[User talk:RedheadRachel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/RedheadRachel|contribs]]) 16:13, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
Hello there guys! Has anyone else been having some serious trouble with editing conflicts preventing them posting things to the Wikibook? The past few times I've tried to add or edit it just won't let me and my text just disappears. I don't know it's just me are not... From now on I'm writing stuff on word like Greg suggested before,but it's been infuriating! How have other people been finding it? [[User:LittleBlondeLottie|LittleBlondeLottie]] ([[User talk:LittleBlondeLottie|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/LittleBlondeLottie|contribs]])
Hi Lottie, don't know if this will be too late but when an editing conflict occurs you just need to click back the page to get your work back. Then just copy and paste it into the new version. [[User:GemmaMiller|GemmaMiller]] ([[User talk:GemmaMiller|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/GemmaMiller|contribs]]) 16:36, 3 April 2014 (UTC)
Hey guys. I was wondering if we should include sub headings within the Main concepts section for each concept ? Was thinking it would be a good way to organize the different concepts? What do you guys think ? ([[User:Kaf00023|Kaf00023]] ([[User talk:Kaf00023|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kaf00023|contribs]]) 22:34, 24 March 2014 (UTC))
Hey. I agree, I think having subheadings will make the page look more organised and professional. I think that we should start with a detailed description of the actual idea of Always-On Culture and then move on to Turkle and Boyd's ideas, each under their own subheading. What does everyone think? Also, is there something obvious I have missed? [[User:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|KathrynHairUpAndGlasses]] ([[User talk:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|contribs]]) 15:34, 26 March 2014 (UTC)
Should we change the main concepts to be more a section for each thinker than each concepts, or just add each of the main thinkers at the end or start of the section ? ([[User:Kaf00023|Kaf00023]] ([[User talk:Kaf00023|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kaf00023|contribs]]) 22:41, 27 March 2014 (UTC))
Hi guys. I wanted to put in something about the fact that teenagers are more associated with "always-on culture" than any other group of people. Any suggestions of where, under which sub-heading, I should put it? Thanks! [[User:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|KathrynHairUpAndGlasses]] ([[User talk:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|contribs]]) 13:50, 28 March 2014 (UTC)
''''reduced context cues'''' why the double bold here and not elsewhere? Try to be consistent with formatting :o) [[User:GregXenon01|GregXenon01]] ([[User talk:GregXenon01|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/GregXenon01|contribs]]) 15:07, 28 March 2014 (UTC)
Sorry about the double bold on social context cues it was a mistake on my part when making the sub heading and i didn't notice the error till today, however I've fixed it now and will check more carefully next time. As for teenagers being more associated with 'always on culture' you could work it into the idea of being part of a network as they would presumably be the largest part of said network and the implications of that ? ([[User:Kaf00023|Kaf00023]] ([[User talk:Kaf00023|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kaf00023|contribs]]) 22:58, 28 March 2014 (UTC))
We should be sure to remain consistent with danah boyd's name. Some people are capitalising it when she is known for having it in lower case (even her Wikipedia page has it in lower case). (If anyone is dead against lower case just say here so everyone knows to put it like that). Thanks! [[User:SiobhanDMC|SiobhanDMC]] ([[User talk:SiobhanDMC|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/SiobhanDMC|contribs]]) 16:53, 31 March 2014 (UTC)
Should we capitalize boyd's name when it is in the beginning of the sentence? --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 17:55, 31 March 2014 (UTC)
Good idea about putting the idea about teenagers being more associated with always on in the networking section. Thanks. I think if her name is lower case even on her Wikipedia page that we should keep it lower case throughout. [[User:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|KathrynHairUpAndGlasses]] ([[User talk:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|contribs]]) 18:14, 31 March 2014 (UTC)
I've noticed that there are several different ways that we are saying "Always-On Culture". Some have upper and lower case, some all upper case, some all lower case and some are in and some are out of quotations. I think they should all be the same, with perhaps the exception of the first time it should be in upper case. Do you think it should have "" quotations or ''? [[User:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|KathrynHairUpAndGlasses]] ([[User talk:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|contribs]]) 18:33, 31 March 2014 (UTC)
I agree Kathryn that we need to be a bit more consistent in the formatting of the words "Always On Culture". In the module handbook and all our other course material the topic is refered to as 'Always On' Culture - with the culture aspect being titled as 'Always On' not an entire clause phrase and capitalising the C in 'Culture'. I hope that's helpful, what do others think? [[User:LittleBlondeLottie|LittleBlondeLottie]] ([[User talk:LittleBlondeLottie|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/LittleBlondeLottie|contribs]])
I think we should go with what the handbook says. Also, are we putting the references in alphabetical order? Do you think it would look better or do you think they should be in line with where they are in the text? As in, if the reference comes first in the text should it come first in the reference list? [[User:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|KathrynHairUpAndGlasses]] ([[User talk:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|contribs]]) 19:02, 31 March 2014 (UTC)
I'm not sure about the references - alphabetical will probably look better but the majority of Wiki pages/books have them in the order they are references in [[User:SiobhanDMC|SiobhanDMC]] ([[User talk:SiobhanDMC|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/SiobhanDMC|contribs]]) 19:17, 31 March 2014 (UTC)
I think we need to link our references to where they are located in the text. Also, the citations in the text are not all formatted in the same way. --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 14:29, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
Hey guys I had a thought about smart mobs after today's lecture. More the fact that in order to fully function, and effectively act out 'spontaneous' action, the mob has to be always on i.e. in order to quickly muster for a project with a deadline (us) or for like a protest (like what happened in Eygpt). Anyone think its relevant enough to add in? Just to reference another chapter? [[User:RobboAdare13|RobboAdare13]] ([[User talk:RobboAdare13|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/RobboAdare13|contribs]]) 15:26, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
Oh yeh, just clocked the online identity page... They have a hell of a lot more content than us haha. We might have to do more reading, <u>if</u> there is anymore stuff to read about this! [[User:RobboAdare13|RobboAdare13]] ([[User talk:RobboAdare13|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/RobboAdare13|contribs]]) 16:02, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
In Turkle's work on the 'tethered self' she tied in a lot of other topics such as "connections that matter" and "new forms of validation." I think it would be useful to add in subheadings under the 'tethered self' discussing these topics as well. Some content that we can include is a portion about the positive and negative aspects of being 'always on.' --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 16:17, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
If we do add a section related to the up and downsides to always being connected, one of the downsides could be the concept of "Disconnectivity Anxiety" --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 16:42, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
I think the idea of putting in the section of smart mobs is a really good idea! That way, like you said, we have linked in to other topics. Do you think it should be under it's own heading or a sub-heading of something else? [[User:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|KathrynHairUpAndGlasses]] ([[User talk:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|contribs]]) 17:56, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
Hi. I've added some more information to the introduction, so that it has a bit more depth. However, I do not think that the introduction should be too long. [[User:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|KathrynHairUpAndGlasses]] ([[User talk:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|contribs]]) 18:19, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
I just wanted to say, I was going to link one of my paragraphs to the page on Online Identity. I saw that someone had put in a link to Shirley Turkle's wiki page and like the idea it all being interlinked. [[User:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|KathrynHairUpAndGlasses]] ([[User talk:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|contribs]]) 18:35, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
Didn't we agree to have boyd's name lowercase throughout the chapter? Should I change it back? --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 18:56, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
Yeah, I think that if it is lower case on her wiki page then we should have it in ours. [[User:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|KathrynHairUpAndGlasses]] ([[User talk:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|contribs]]) 19:16, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
Also, in regards to the referencing, do you think we should put in footnotes? I think that might look better and that way, the references will be in order. [[User:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|KathrynHairUpAndGlasses]] ([[User talk:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|contribs]]) 19:20, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
I think footnotes are a good idea. The idea of smart mobs could be included as an advantage to "always-on" --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 20:27, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
I think we should definitely include the section on disconnectivity anxiety, it's not something that was covered in the lectures so I think it would be a good thing to research and add.
[[User:Katrinamcaleer|Katrinamcaleer]] ([[User talk:Katrinamcaleer|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Katrinamcaleer|contribs]]) 20:32, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
I added advantage and disadvantage sections. Let me know if you guys like that layout or would like the content to be rearranged. --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 20:51, 1 April 2014 (UTC)
In terms of layout I think that looks great. Do you think I should just put my section about privacy under disadvantages? [[User:Katrinamcaleer|Katrinamcaleer]] ([[User talk:Katrinamcaleer|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Katrinamcaleer|contribs]]) 08:03, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
Hey everyone, I just moved my content about theorists Sherry Turkle and Leslie Perlow into the main section. Some parts are repeated about Sherry Turkle as I am yet to edit it. Feel free to edit and change information I have added. [[User:Amandajayner|Amandajayner]] ([[User talk:Amandajayner|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Amandajayner|contribs]]) 10:19, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
Hi - that's my stuff about "Being 'On': the different means of getting connected" moved over to the main page too - edit it as you want! I'll have a go at trying to put the increasing number of references into alphabetical order so that our collective page is a bit closer to "ready" for Friday night.[[User:George Berrie|George Berrie]] ([[User talk:George Berrie|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/George Berrie|contribs]]) 10:49, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
Hey George... just saw your additions to the main page! Looking good! However, I was wondering if that should maybe be moved down under the other main topics. I'm just opening that point up for potential discussion as it's still relevant but I think the book should start off with more about "Always On" itself. Readers who don't know what "Always On" is might need more information up front. Thoughts everybody? Would anyone object to having the two parts divided into 'references' and 'notes' like the [[Digital_Media_and_Culture_Yearbook_2014/Chapter_2:_Online_Identity#Notes|online identity page]] has done? --[[User:IsmayH|IsmayH]] ([[User talk:IsmayH|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/IsmayH|contribs]]) 10:36, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
The problem at this stage is that everyone is still trying to add new information or expand greater on points that have already been made, but in many places it just reads badly as it's too repetitive. I'd say what we need to do now is look closely at each set ion and try and make certain parts more concise and to the point. [[User:Cir00004|Cir00004]] ([[User talk:Cir00004|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Cir00004|contribs]]) 11:36, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
Thanks Gemma! It was bugging me a little. And yeah, I'm just going through the page at the moment and seeing which bits need little edits and which points are repeating themselves or need a little expansion. [[User:SiobhanDMC|SiobhanDMC]] ([[User talk:SiobhanDMC|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/SiobhanDMC|contribs]]) 12:17, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
We have disinhibition in both the main concepts and definitions section. Should it just be put into one so it isn't repeating things? I can try to work it together somehow. [[User:SiobhanDMC|SiobhanDMC]] ([[User talk:SiobhanDMC|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/SiobhanDMC|contribs]]) 13:10, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
After finally figuring out how to do the number reference thing, I've changed all my citations! Sorry about that. Also, I have my afternoon free so I'm comfortable with going through the page and editing. I agree that our page is unnecessarily long and if you read it top to bottom, there is more than one repetitive paragraph. I can see what I can do about that if you guys want. [[User:RedheadRachel|RedheadRachel]] ([[User talk:RedheadRachel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/RedheadRachel|contribs]]) 14:00, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
I think that's a good idea because there does seem to be repetitive information. I will try to go through and edit as well. --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 14:24, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
Does anyone think we should add more to cultural determinism? It's looking a bit thin. --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 14:57, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
Just noticed that we have two disinhibition sections, should we combine the two or just get rid of one? --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 15:38, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
Haha.... just had that same thought I was going to post! I think we should combine them under main concepts... thoughts? [[User:RedheadRachel|RedheadRachel]] ([[User talk:RedheadRachel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/RedheadRachel|contribs]]) 15:28, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
For a stronger book chapter, I think we should lead with the main concepts. By leading with the definitions, we are introducing too many ideas too fast. Also, I'm combining the two disinhibition sections because they say nearly the same thing. [[User:RedheadRachel|RedheadRachel]] ([[User talk:RedheadRachel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/RedheadRachel|contribs]]) 15:37, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
I agree. I think that definitions and glossary are too similar of sections to have. Definitely combine the disinhibition sections. We might have to do that with the two determinism sections as well. --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 15:38, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
I wonder if we should move the definitions sections (that aren't repetitive) as their own subheading under main concepts and then we can lead the main concepts section with the most relevant ideas to 'always-on'. Online disinhibition and the like is important to our topic but it's not the most important. [[User:RedheadRachel|RedheadRachel]] ([[User talk:RedheadRachel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/RedheadRachel|contribs]]) 15:41, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
I think that's a good idea. How should we approach the determinism sections? --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 15:45, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
I'll look at those now. [[User:RedheadRachel|RedheadRachel]] ([[User talk:RedheadRachel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/RedheadRachel|contribs]]) 15:49, 4 April 2014 (UTC)
== Referencing ==
FOOTNOTE HELP. Am I being silly or have I missed how to add in a footnote? Had a look around my text box but can't find. Thanks for your time [[User:JustHollie|JustHollie]] ([[User talk:JustHollie|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/JustHollie|contribs]]) 17:20, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
Actually Just to bring it to everyone's attention we have two types of referencing going on... we will need to go through and just have one type... [[User:JustHollie|JustHollie]] ([[User talk:JustHollie|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/JustHollie|contribs]]) 17:30, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
I agree, what type of reference should we stick with? --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 17:49, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
I am thinking APA seen as most of it is styled with it, just means we would have to find those who have done the few parts in foot notes to change? I think it would be more difficult to footnote as we would have to go through all the references and match them up to specific numbers [[User:JustHollie|JustHollie]] ([[User talk:JustHollie|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/JustHollie|contribs]]) 17:58, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
My only concern is that footnotes look more like a Wikibook to me and less like an essay. What are your thoughts on that? If we decide to go with footnotes, I can go through and format all of them --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 18:12, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
I think that would be ok, just if someone would help you or go over it to make sure nothing is missed or anything. It does look more like other projects. would be good to get some other people's opinion on it too but I think it sounds good. [[User:JustHollie|JustHollie]] ([[User talk:JustHollie|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/JustHollie|contribs]]) 18:29, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
Hey thanks for pointing this out Hollie. Wiki only asks that we are consistent so that is what we should aim for. I must admit, I like Kelly's idea of making it more like a Wikibook and although many have gone for APA (us included) if Kelly is offering to format it the way she suggests then I say we go for it. I was going to ask the rest of my own team but this might take a while to get overall consensus based on how Wiki works (!) so why don't we just ask the nice Kelly to change it to a single consistent format - that way we will be in line with Wiki's standards - and if anyone has any energy left to change it to another consistent format then they can feel free to do it. How does that sound?[[User:George Berrie|George Berrie]] ([[User talk:George Berrie|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/George Berrie|contribs]]) 18:52, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
Hey! I agree with you all concerning APA as my group chose that for referencing and I think it is the style most people have used. I personally like the idea of footnotes but I don't mind if we don't use them. Like George says, consistency is key. [[User:Amandajayner|Amandajayner]] ([[User talk:Amandajayner|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Amandajayner|contribs]]) 20:12, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
The APA style that seems to be mostly used at the moment sounds good to me! It shoudn't be too different to change the ones that don't fit the style on Friday if need be. [[User:SiobhanDMC|SiobhanDMC]] ([[User talk:SiobhanDMC|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/SiobhanDMC|contribs]]) 20:17, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
About to fix some of my referencing, so is the consensus no footnotes? [[User:Amandajayner|Amandajayner]] ([[User talk:Amandajayner|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Amandajayner|contribs]]) 20:25, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
Sounds good, Kelly go ahead if you are feeling up to it, if not we can just style it all to APA on Friday [[User:JustHollie|JustHollie]] ([[User talk:JustHollie|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/JustHollie|contribs]]) 20:34, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
I'll get on it tonight! --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 21:35, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
Ugh, I hate editing conflicts. I'll try this again. I was just saying that I think we should avoid APA in-text citations if possible as it reads more like an essay, instead of a Wikibook/Wikipedia page. I clicked on a random WikiBook page and found this one which I like the citation style it uses: [[Natural and Cultural History of North-East Australia's Wet Tropical Forests]]. It appears clearer but in the interest of time, I'll keep citing using APA. If, on Friday, we have time, we can work to change it to a different style. Unless Kelly is up for it! I don't want to be pushy! Kelly.marvel is a star! [[User:RedheadRachel|RedheadRachel]] ([[User talk:RedheadRachel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/RedheadRachel|contribs]]) 21:46, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
Like a few of the others have said, I'm sure we'll be fine using any of the suggested referencing styles as long as we keep it consistent throughout. It may be an idea to sneak a peek at the other book chapters and see how the other groups are referencing. [[User:Katrinamcaleer|Katrinamcaleer]] ([[User talk:Katrinamcaleer|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Katrinamcaleer|contribs]]) 21:53, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
I've already started changing the citations to keep them consistent. However, under the "toxic dis-inhibition effect" section, there is a reference to BBC 2011 but I cannot find any link matching the name and date. Could someone let me know what this is referencing? --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 22:13, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
Same goes for the ABC 2011 reference in that section--[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 22:15, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
Under the 'Advantages' section, there are two references (Fred Stutzman, Carnegie Mellon) and (Laura B. Weiss, 2012) that are not referenced at the bottom --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 22:32, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
This may be a silly question but how do we go about changing the citations to match this when we add new content. I don't want to mess up all of your hard work! [[User:Katrinamcaleer|Katrinamcaleer]] ([[User talk:Katrinamcaleer|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Katrinamcaleer|contribs]]) 22:51, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
In order to figure out how to reference, all you have to do is look at the book through edit mode. I would show you exactly what to type but then it comes up as a citation on here. You can look at this <ref> insert full citation </ref> on the edit mode of the discussion page in order to see the formatting if that is easier. I hope that helps! If you're having diffucltly then let me know what section you're working on and I can insert the reference --[[User:Kelly.marvel|Kelly.marvel]] ([[User talk:Kelly.marvel|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Kelly.marvel|contribs]]) 10:34, 3 April 2014 (UTC)
Thank you, that does help. I'll give it a go and I'll let you know if I do get stuck, thanks. [[User:Katrinamcaleer|Katrinamcaleer]] ([[User talk:Katrinamcaleer|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Katrinamcaleer|contribs]]) 17:14, 3 April 2014 (UTC)
I think that the idea of making it more like a wikibook by using footnotes is a great idea! I am going to attempt to put the references I have used into footnotes but I see that Kelly is offering help if anyone needs it, there is a strong possibility I may so thanks in advance! [[User:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|KathrynHairUpAndGlasses]] ([[User talk:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|contribs]]) 18:13, 3 April 2014 (UTC)
Is the information we we have to have in the footnotes the same that is in the APA reference? Also, are the reference in bullet points the ones that have to be deleted after they have been made into footnotes? [[User:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|KathrynHairUpAndGlasses]] ([[User talk:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|contribs]]) 18:18, 3 April 2014 (UTC)
Okay, so I have put in the footnotes in the paragraphs I have done. I'm still unsure about whether the references in bullet points have to be deleted when they are turned into footnotes. I'm assuming that we do so I am just going to delete them from that list. I have all of the information in case I wasn't supposed to so I can put them back in. [[User:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|KathrynHairUpAndGlasses]] ([[User talk:KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/KathrynHairUpAndGlasses|contribs]]) 18:44, 3 April 2014 (UTC)
The page is looking great. What else needs done before tomorrow? [[User:Amandajayner|Amandajayner]] ([[User talk:Amandajayner|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Amandajayner|contribs]]) 19:09, 3 April 2014 (UTC)
Honestly having trouble thinking of really anything else to add to this page. Gonna see if I can find some original stuff that's a little less tied to the readings and such to add to the page. Hopefully that'll work well enough. [[User:Americanstephen|Americanstephen]] ([[User talk:Americanstephen|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Americanstephen|contribs]]) 20:12, 3 April 2014 (UTC) == Link to your page? ==
Hey guys, I'm doing the section on Technological Imperative from the Tech Determinism page - basically this idea is that whatever developments we could make with technology, we will just because we can. This fits with y'alls work on inhibition; people will lose sense of whether they should do something online simply because they can push the limits. Would it be alright if I linked to y'alls page from this section?
Thanks!
[[User:AlexaSoccer|AlexaSoccer]] ([[User talk:AlexaSoccer|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/AlexaSoccer|contribs]]) 18:27, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
I don't see why that would be a problem, I like the idea of interlinking the pages. Could we do it back to yours? [[User:SiobhanDMC|SiobhanDMC]] ([[User talk:SiobhanDMC|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/SiobhanDMC|contribs]]) 20:18, 2 April 2014 (UTC)
Definitely! Working on fine tuning the page just now so will let you know when it's ready to link! [[User:AlexaSoccer|AlexaSoccer]] ([[User talk:AlexaSoccer|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/AlexaSoccer|contribs]]) 10:21, 3 April 2014 (UTC)
== Glossary ==
Just a wee thought, would be good if we could keep the glossary in alphabetical order? I will do it the now and if any one adds any more just put in in the correct way. Looks neater and easier to read especially if more is to be added. Happy editing [[User:JustHollie|JustHollie]] ([[User talk:JustHollie|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/JustHollie|contribs]]) 14:17, 3 April 2014 (UTC)
Actually the glossary is a bit of a riot and needs some TLC, there are repeats and the layout is all different so I will go ahead and edit it to make it all consistent [[User:JustHollie|JustHollie]] ([[User talk:JustHollie|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/JustHollie|contribs]]) 14:24, 3 April 2014 (UTC)
Are we also going to add a list of 'contributors' at the end of our page? I notice that other groups have done so. [[User:JustHollie|JustHollie]] ([[User talk:JustHollie|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/JustHollie|contribs]]) 15:14, 3 April 2014 (UTC)
Some of my group, including myself, put our names under the 'contributors' title on the main page. But it may be a good idea to add it to this page as well. [[User:Amandajayner|Amandajayner]] ([[User talk:Amandajayner|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/Amandajayner|contribs]]) 19:05, 3 April 2014 (UTC)

== Welcome! ==
[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, MartinPoulter!
[[File:Crystal Clear app kedit.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for [[WB:AGF|collaborative]] development of free [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].''' You do not need technical skills to [[Using Wikibooks|contribute]]. You can [[WB:BOLD|easily change most books]]. Please [[WB:CHAT|introduce yourself]], and let us know what [[WB:PROJECTS|interests you]]. If you already contribute at other Wikimedia projects, our [[Wikibooks:Wikibooks for Wikimedians|Wikimedia Orientation]] should quickly get you started.
(Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?)
[[File:Icon apps query.svg|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Getting help'''
* Read the [[Using Wikibooks]] book for a friendly introduction to the project, or our [[Help:Contents|help pages]] for more information. * You can get friendly help from the community in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]] or our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * Upload freely licensed files to [[commons:Wikimedia Commons|Wikimedia Commons]]. You may [[WB:RFP|request permission]] to upload [[w:fair use|fair use]] files locally. Please include author and source {{tl|information}} and a {{nowrap|{{tl|non-free use rationale}}}} for [[WB:FU|non-free]] files.
[[File:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* You can [[WB:REVERT|restore]] a previously saved version. * Pages should follow the [[WB:NP|'''Book Title/Chapter Title''']] naming convention. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (is available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To request a page be deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason''}} to the top of the page. * Was a page you made deleted? Please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
[[File:Transmission icon.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[WB:ES|the edit summary]] and [[WB:PREVIEW|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[WB:TALK|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
Thanks, --[[User:Xania|ЗAНИA]] [[Image:Flag_of_Estonia.svg|15px]][[User talk:Xania|talk]] 22:35, 24 March 2014 (UTC)

revision.comment: Fabartus moved page [[Trainz Highest Ver]] to [[Trainz/Trainz Highest]]: never supposed to be here
revision.text:
3.9
{{Trainz-admin}} {{Text-box|This is a resource page, and certainly '''''not''' part of the book meant for direct viewing'' by readers.}} ;usage Use this page as if a template, but put the call into main space mode by inserting a leading colon just like this: 
 {{:Trainz/Trainz Highest Ver}}
Otherwise, without the lead colon, the call will be processed to template namespace. Just use in-line in a sentence following the V- or V like this: * The version number (or Trainz-build value), range from V-1.0 to V-3.7, and corresponds to requirements Trainz places on 3D asset data definitions—and ''when found in an asset {{TR|R|Config.txt file|p=configuration file}}, tells the software suite the way they are to be processed. The older the version, the more translation steps to display the 3D models in the current latest versions. It's a clever system that has allowed Trainz route builders access to literally hundreds of thousands of assets from the {{TL|Download Station}}.
*where the sentence part is formed literally as shown here: range from V-1.0 to V-{{:Trainz Highest Ver}}, and corresponds to [[Category:Trainz|$Highest]][[Category:Trainz Templates|$Highest]]

page.title: Professionalism/Julia Bluhm, SPARK, and Seventeen Magazine

revision.text:
==Introduction== [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Photo_manipulation Photo manipulation] software is not new, but recently it is generating controversy. While the public generally accepts that [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adobe_Photoshop Photoshop] will be used for retouching purposes (lighting, flyaway hair, skin imperfections, and such), [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xKQdwjGiF-s viral videos] demonstrate the astonishing transformation a model’s pictures undergo between a photo shoot and publication. This transformation is rooted in altering models’ bodies, often so drastically that the original model is unrecognizable in the final picture. Many famous figures, including actress [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lena_Dunham Lena Dunham] and supermodel [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cindy_Crawford Cindy Crawford], recognize the unrealistic representations of celebrities presented in magazines. When Crawford was asked how she maintains the level of beauty people see pictured, she responded, "Even I don't look like Cindy Crawford”<ref> (1993, January 11). People Magazine. Retrieved from http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20149820,00.html </ref>. Body image alterations set unrealistic expectations about how a person should look. Is the use of photo editing software highlighting the best the model could look, or is it simply displaying an altered reality?
==In The News== Target recently suffered from media and customer backlash for mistakenly publishing junior bathing suit advertisements on their website with blatant Photoshop errors, including [http://assets.nydailynews.com/polopoly_fs/1.1717746.1394555823!/img/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/article_970/target12n-2-web.jpg jagged edges under the model’s arm], [http://www.gannett-cdn.com/-mm-/e254b711483e4040a126d2d41a9ab6ebf62a8f6c/c=228-0-1185-719&r=x404&c=534x401/local/-/media/KARE/KARE/2014/03/12//1394665160000-Target-Photoshop.jpg a chunk missing at the apex of the model’s thighs], and [http://i.huffpost.com/gen/1671428/thumbs/o-TARGET-570.jpg?7 impossibly lengthened arms]. The error was addressed online and went viral. Much of the outrage stems from the images marketing to juniors who look to the media to set expectations about the way they should look. If the digital artist had used the correct tools or taken time to edit precisely before the image was published, many would have never guessed the images were Photoshopped. The response towards Target was harsh because the almost farcical errors made it obvious they intended to use Photoshop to alter the shape of the model’s body. Altering body images in the media is offensive to many, primarily because of the hypothesized links between media pressure and psychological disorders, such as depression and eating disorders<ref> Shaw, J., & Waller, G. (1995). The Media’s Impact on Body Image: Implications for Prevention and Treatment. Eating Disorders, 3(2), 115–123. </ref>.
==False Advertising== Beyond the psychological implications of photo manipulation in magazines, there are problems with maintaining integrity in advertisements. Despite general awareness that photos in magazines are manipulated, most often a reader of a magazine does not consciously register that the images displayed have been drastically altered. One industry in which honesty is especially difficult to regulate is the beauty industry. The goal of an advertisement is primarily to entice the audience to purchase a product, but to what extent is it ethical to represent a beauty product with a manipulated image?
In some cases, companies have crossed this line. For example, a [http://static1.businessinsider.com/image/4f298902eab8eaff5200002b-1200/julia-roberts-lancome-uk.jpg Lancome advertisement depicting Julia Roberts] was banned in the United Kingdom because the makeup was advertised to removed wrinkles and crow’s feet, but the company used photo manipulation to remove these features from the picture. This type of false advertising can mislead consumers. Deception in advertising can drive uninformed purchases. If [http://progressive.kelbymediagroup.com/scottkelby/wp-content/uploads/2009/08/peoplemag.jpg Kelly Clarkson appears on the cover of a magazine promoting a diet and exercise regimen] she claims worked for her, the readers would expect that her picture conveys the results of this regimen. If the readers knew her figure had been altered in the picture, they could adjust their expectations, putting less faith in a regimen which has not demonstrated its results fairly to the readers.
==Julia Bluhm, SPARK, & Seventeen Magazine== [http://livingmyhilife.files.wordpress.com/2012/07/julia-bluhm-learning-blog480.jpg Julia Bluhm] is a high school student from Pittsfield, Massachusetts training to be a professional ballerina <ref>The SPARKteam | SPARK Movement. (n.d.). SPARK Movement RSS. Retrieved May 2, 2014, from http://www.sparksummit.com/sparkteam/</ref>. As expected with a highly physical sport obsessed with how the performers look on stage, she listened to many of her peers talk about "feeling bloated", "having a fat day", and other guilty eating phrases associated with eating disorders <ref> Bluhm, J. (2012, January 1). Seventeen Magazine Gives Girls Images of Real Girls!. Change.org. Retrieved May 2, 2014, from https://www.change.org/petitions/seventeen-magazine-give-girls-images-of-real-girls</ref>. But it was not just her ballerina friends talking negatively about their own body images, her peers at school were having similar conversations.
Julia got involved with the [http://www.sparksummit.com SPARK (Sexualization, Protest: Action, Resistance, Knowledge) Movement] when she was in 8th grade, and her interest in media treatment of women and feminist activism increased. SPARK Movement's mission is to train girls and young women ages 13 to 22 about effective activism and how to separate healthy sexuality and sexualization of women in the media. This grassroots group has many partners, including [http://www.hghw.org/content/research Hardy Girls Healthy Women], which Julia sits on the girls advisory board <ref>The SPARKteam | SPARK Movement. (n.d.). SPARK Movement RSS. Retrieved May 2, 2014, from http://www.sparksummit.com/sparkteam/</ref>.
Julia's connection with SPARK Movement "sparked" her engine to do something about the negative attitude at her school which she felt stemmed from presentation of teens in magazines and on television. In the spring of 2012, Julia Bluhm decided that Photoshop in teen magazines needed to be reduced. Julia Bluhm, with backing from the [http://www.sparksummit.com/ SPARK Movement], posted a petition, tiled [http://www.change.org/petitions/seventeen-magazine-give-girls-images-of-real-girls "Seventeen Magazine: Give Girls Images of Real Girls,"] on [http://www.change.org/ Change.org], asking that [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Seventeen_%28Magazine%29 Seventeen Magazine] print at least one spread per issue without Photoshop.
By May 2012, Julia's petition had about 84,000 signatures and she felt it was time to present the results to Seventeen Magazine in person. She hosted a [http://assets.nydailynews.com/polopoly_fs/1.1071384!/img/httpImage/image.jpg_gen/derivatives/landscape_635/image.jpg fake photo-shoot] outside of Seventeen Magazine's headquarters in New York <ref>Gregoire, C. (2012, July 5). Julia Bluhm, 14, Leads Successful Petition For Seventeen Magazine To Portray Girls Truthfully. The Huffington Post. Retrieved May 2, 2014, from http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/07/05/julia-bluhm-seventeen-mag_n_1650938.html</ref>. Julia and her fellow protesters held signs with slogans such as, "A magazine for me? Make it look like me" yet again reminding the crowd that she is taking a stance against deception through photo manipulation. She received an [http://www.sparksummit.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/julia-interview-224x300.jpg overwhelming response] from the media, and finally [http://i.perezhilton.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/julia-bluhm-ann-shoket-seventeen-magazine-petition__oPt.jpg met with the editor-in-chief] of Seventeen Magazine, [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ann_Shoket Ann Shoket].
Ann Shoket first responded defensively, releasing a press statement that Seventeen Magazine does not "alter girl's body and face shape"<ref>Botelho, G., & Abbey, M. (1970, January 1). Seventeen magazine vows not to alter images, to 'celebrate every kind of beauty'. CNN. Retrieved May 2, 2014, from http://www.cnn.com/2012/07/05/us/seventeen-photoshopping/</ref>. But in August 2012, she solidified her statement by printing a full spread "[http://graphics8.nytimes.com/images/2012/07/04/business/Seventeen/Seventeen-blog480.jpg Body Peace Treaty]" with all of the editors signatures. In the issue, Seventeen Magazine promised to "never change girls' body and face shapes", "always feature real girls who are healthy", and "celebrate every kind of beauty" <ref>Shoket, A. (2012, August 1). Seventeen Magazine's Body Peace Treaty. Seventeen.</ref>. Although they did not promise to remove photo-manipulation completely from their magazine, they showed an example edit in the spread and promised to post all pre-edited photos on their tumblr, "[http://seventeen.tumblr.com/ Behind the Scenes at Seventeen!]"
==Julia Bluhm and Professionalism== [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Feynman Richard Feynman] is another person who used his voice and position in the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rogers_Commission_Report Rogers Commission Report] to address issues he had seen in the culture around him. Although Julia Bluhm's task may seem trivial in comparison Feynman addressing the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_Shuttle_Challenger_disaster Challenger disaster], she took a stance and instead of backing down, made sure that at least 86,000 girls and their parents became more aware of the impact photo editing has on adolescent girls. Her goal was to bring to light media pressures that lead to an unhealthy social culture in America. Julia Bluhm is a professional because she did not sit on her laurels, like Dan Applegate, and allow what she thought was a failure to pass by uncontested. She fought for what was right, even when it seemed like impossible odds that would mark her different among her friends.
For more about Julia's journey, from Julia Bluhm herself, check out her [http://tedxwomen.org/speakers/juliabluhm-izzy-labbe/ TedxWomen Talk].
==Photography, Truth, and Ethics== Historically, photography was the first way to record reality more truthfully than any other art form. People therefore developed a mental model that photography represents truth. As Ludwig Wittgenstein said, "a picture is a fact" <ref>Wittgenstein, Ludwig. (1922). Tractatus Logico-Philosophicus. Logisch-philosophische Abhandlung. Retrieved May 3, 2013 from http://people.umass.edu/phil335-klement-2/tlp/tlp-ebook.pdf </ref>. However, Tushnet contends that when people "treat images as transparent" they "deny that interpretation is necessary, claiming both that the meaning of the image is so obvious that it admits of no serious debate and that the image is a mere representation of reality" <ref> Tushnet, R. (2012, January 1). Worth a thousand words: the images of copyright. Retrieved May 3, 2014 from Virgo. </ref>. Is it ethically permissible to edit something that people believe to be the truth, or is it the viewers' responsibility to recognize that photographs do not always depict reality?
Photo-manipulation technology has advanced so much that it is undetectable. There is now talk of not allowing digital photos to be evidence in courts of law. People cannot simply look at an image and know with certainty if it has been edited or not. Levy-Sachs and Sullivan acknowledge the advantages of digital photography, but content that in order to rely on photographs as evidence, the legal community needs to become more aware "of the characteristics of digital images that could make them less reliable as evidence than traditional photographs" <ref> Levy-Sachs, R., Sullivan, M. (2004, August). Using Digital Photographs in the Courtroom - Considerations for Admissibility. Retrieved May 3, 2014 from http://www.securitymanagement.com/archive/library/feature_August2004.pdf </ref>. Currently, there is protocol law enforcement must follow when handling digital evidence and regulations on the authentication of those digital images <ref> Cameron, S. (2011, August). Digital Evidence. The Federal Bureau of Investigation. Retrieved May 3, 2014, from http://www.fbi.gov/stats-services/publications/law-enforcement-bulletin/august-2011/digital-evidence </ref>. The 2004 ''Connecticut v. Swinton'' Supreme Court case provides the guidelines for utilizing enhanced photographic evidence-- there must be a computer expert's testimony about the software used, and the reliability of the procedures must be examined <ref> Flamm, S., Solomon, S. (2004). Admissibility of Digital Exhibits in Litigation. Retrieved May 3, 2014 from http://www.evidencephotographers.com/documents/doar.pdf</ref>.
Some photographers contend magazines are creating art and not news, so the goal of the photography shown there is not to display reality, but rather the photographer's artful interpretation of reality <ref>Lodriguss, J. The Ethics of Digital Manipulation. Catching the Light. Retrieved April 6, 2014 from http://www.astropix.com/HTML/J_DIGIT/ETHICS.HTM </ref>. Photographers claim that if the photographer's goal is to represent reality, photo-manipulation can help them do this. Sometimes the only way to reproduce a scene with a camera the way the human eye would have seen it is through photo-manipulation; for example, when red-eye is removed. Others cite cases where photo-manipulation has been used to create public blindness by being misleading or deceptive. They show cases where Photoshop has been used to [http://terrifictop10.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/lenin-altered-photo.jpg remove people from photos after losing political favor], [http://weburbanist.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/10/mussolini-on-horseback.jpg to make leaders appear more powerful], or to [http://terrifictop10.files.wordpress.com/2013/06/bush-holding-book.jpg just make others look dumb]. Researchers question whether this misuse of photo-manipulation will effect the credibility of photojournalism and believe that the trend of altering photos will cause more scandals <ref>Ricchiardi, S. (2007, Aug/Sep). Distorted Picture. American Journalism Review. Retrieved May 3, 2014 from Virgo </ref>.
Can't the same techniques used to enhance images for court cases or create political blindness be used in magazines to distort viewers' perceptions of reality on a more social and psychological level? The [https://nppa.org/ National Press Photographers Association], whose goal is to promote integrity in visual journalism declares no photo should deceive the public no matter the source or audience <ref>National Press Photographers Association. The Voice of Visual Journalists. Retrieved May 3, 2014 from https://nppa.org/page/5167 </ref>.
==Conclusion== As demonstrated with both the Julia Bluhm case and examples from history, photo-manipulation in magazines can deceive the public. It is the public's responsibility to determine if Photoshop in the media is a misuse of technology. Julia Bluhm teaches others that no matter the how high-reaching or trivial their goal may seem, professionals need to voice their judgements to create change and awareness. Consumers should not be forced to change their ethics as technology advances, but they should be ready to assess whether some uses of photo-manipulation are ethical or not. The line where the pursuit of aesthetics violates ethics needs to be defined.
==References== <references />
