page.title: Spirituality in India - A Cultural Perspective/Durability of spiritual traditions

revision.text:
A fascinating aspect of Indian spirituality, specifically in the context of Hinduism, is its durability across hundreds and even thousands of years. As mentioned in the previous chapter, yoga as a practice seems to have been known in the Harappan civilization 5000 years ago. Similarly, the association of the triangle with feminine worship seems to have been present 11,000 years ago. This chapter will look at a few more examples of such nature.
== Sanskrit == Sanskrit is one of the more well known examples. Sanskrit is among the oldest languages of the Indo–European group of languages. Though no longer a widely spoken language, it is still extremely important as the classical language of Indian culture and the sacred language of Hinduism. Sanskrit, in its oldest known form entered North-West India during the second half of the second millennium BC, at which time it was similar in nature to its relative Avestan. Later, it spread into North India and came to be the preferred language of communication in cultural and religious aspects. The language evolved during the Vedic period until it was standardized by the grammarian Panini around the fourth century BC. Thereafter, his grammatical rules were generally followed with exactness, to the present day.<ref>{{cite book |title=Encyclopedia of Language and Linguistics |last=Brown |first=Keith |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=1993|publisher=Elsevier|location= |isbn=978-0-08-044854-1 |page=9188 |pages=}}</ref>
== Harappan civilization == A continuity between the Harappan civilization and several practices found in the region inpresent times has been proposed by some scholars. For example, the units of measurement for length and weight are said to be similar. A similarity of housing plans has also been shown between houses in Mohenjodaro and modern Gujarat. Similarities have also been found in construction techniques. Structural similarities, namely the ratio between the breadth and length of a structure have been shown between the building of the Harrapan civilization and the later Mauryan period. This ratio is also found in the sacrificial altars of vedic rites which are practiced in modern India. Parallels have also been drawn between Vedic Soma sacrifices and Harrapan fire altars.<ref namə"Danino">{{cite book |title=The Lost River |last=Danino |first=Michel|authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2010|publisher=Penguin Books|location= |isbn=9780143068648 |url=http://books.google.co.in/books?id=8yc7-OirxKEC&lpg=PP1&dq=danino%20saraswati&pg=PA196#v=onepage&q&f=false}}</ref> It has also been suggested that a sculpture of a male, called the "Priest King," found in Mohenjodaro may represent a yogi pose, with his eyes focused on the tip of his nose, half closed in concentration.<ref>{{cite book |title=A Handbook of Ancient Religions |last=Hinnells|first=|authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2008 |publisher=Cambridge University Press|location= |isbn=9781139461986|page=450 |pages= |url=http://books.google.co.in/books?id=FIYiil96ZXAC&lpg=PA450&dq=priest%20king%20yogi&pg=PA450#v=onepage&q&f=false |accessdate=4 April 2014}}</ref>
== Historicity of festivals == === Navratri and Dussehra === There is evidence that the slaying of the buffalo demon by the goddess Durga was present as early as 1st Century BC. However, the DUrga cult could possibly date further back into prehistoric times. Towards the end of the Gupta period in North India and the Chola period in South India, the worship of Durga took the form of a ten-day festival associated with war. Besides martial rites, fertility rites and kingship rites associated with wealth were also present.<ref>{{cite book |title=Mysore Royal Dasara |last=Sivapriyanand|first=Swami|authorlink= |coauthors= |year=1995 |publisher=Abhinav Publications|location= |isbn=9781139461986 |pages= |url=http://books.google.co.in/books?id=DVkyFvZL_qMC&lpg=PA31&dq=history%20of%20navaratri&pg=PA37#v=onepage&q&f=false |accessdate=4 April 2014}}</ref> In the present day, these three factors are still found, represented as Durga, Lakshmi and Saraswati, each allocated three of the nine days of Navratri, with the tenth day being Vijayadashami or the day of victory.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://blog.ishafoundation.org/lifestyle/dussehra-vijayadashami/ |title=Dussehra or Vijayadashami – Why Do We Celebrate It? |author= |date=14 October 2013 |work= |publisher=Isha Blog |accessdate=4 April 2014}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}} {{status|0%}} {{BookCat}}
Dust [[User:CRC43|CRC43]] ([[User talk:CRC43|discuss]] • [[Special:Contributions/CRC43|contribs]]) 13:47, 4 April 2014 (UTC)

<noinclude> {{navigation|Book=Topology |current=Vector Spaces |previous=Perfect Map |next=Morphisms}} </noinclude>
A '''vector space''' <math>V</math> is formed by scalar multiples of vectors. The scalars are most commonly real numbers but can also be complex, or from any field.
==Definition==
A vector space <math>V</math> on a field <math>F</math> is a set <math>V</math> with two binary operations, commonly vector addition on elements of <math>V</math> and scalar multiplication, by elements of <math>F</math>, of elements of <math>V</math>. These operations are subject to 8 axioms ('''u''','''v''', and '''w''' are vectors <math>\in V</math> and a and b are scalars <math>\in F</math>):
1. Associativity (addition): ('''u'''+'''v''')+'''w''' = '''u'''+('''v'''+'''w''').
2. Associativity (scalar and field multiplication): a(b'''u''') = (ab)'''u'''
3. Distributivity (field addition): (a+b)'''u''' = a'''u'''+b'''u'''
4. Distributivity (vector addition): a('''u'''+'''v''') = a'''u'''+a'''v'''
5. Identity element (addition): <math>\exists</math> '''0''' <math>\in V</math> such that '''u'''+'''0''' = '''u''' <math>\forall</math> '''u''' <math>\in V</math>
6. Identity element (scalar multiplication): 1'''u''' = '''u'''
7. Commutativity: '''u'''+'''v''' = '''v'''+'''u'''
8. Inverse element: <math>\exists</math> -'''u''' <math>\in V</math> such that '''u'''+(-'''u''') = '''0''' <math>\forall</math> '''u''' <math>\in V</math>
[[File:Vector_addition_ans_scaling.png|100x100px|framed|An example of basic arrow vectors: first the black vector as the sum of the red and blue vectors, then the black vector as a sum of the blue vector and a scaling of the red vector (x2)]]
<noinclude> {{navigation|Book=Topology |current=Vector Spaces |previous=Perfect Map |next=Morphisms}}
{{BookCat}} </noinclude>

<noinclude> {{navigation|Book=Topology |current=Simplicial complexes |previous=Induced homomorphism |next=Barycentric coordinates}} </noinclude>
A simplicial complex is a union of spaces known as simplicies, that are convex hulls of points in general position. In Euclidean space they can be thought of as a generalisation of the triangle. For the first few dimensions they are: the point, the line segment, the triangle and the tetrahedron.
==Definition of a simplex==
Given n+1 points <math>\{a_0,a_1,\dots,a_n\}</math>, in a space with dimension of at least n, such that no three points are colinear, the set
:<math>\mathcal{S}=\{t_0a_0+t_1a_1+\dots+t_na_n:\sum_{i=1}^n t_i = 1\text{ with }t_i\in [0,1]\}</math>
is a simplex, and more specifically an n-simplex since it has n+1 verticies.
==The standard n-simplex==
For ease we will sometimes need a standardised co-ordinate system for a simplex. The standard n-simplex, a subset of Euclidean (n+1)-space, <math>\mathbb{R}^{n+1}</math>, is
:<math>\Delta_n=\{(t_0,t_1,\dots,t_n)\in \mathbb{R}^{n+1}: t_i\geq 0\text{ and }\sum^n_{i=0} t_i=1\}</math>
Note that the set is expressed in a very similar manner, but the co-ordinates are fixed in <math>\mathbb{R}^{n+1}</math>.
[[Image:2D-simplex.svg|150px|thumb|right|A diagram of the standard n-simplex in '''R'''<sup>3</sup>, with n=2]]
==Face of a Simplex==
A face of an n-simplex <math>\mathcal{S}</math> is any (n-1)-simplex formed by an n-1 element subset of the verticies of <math>\mathcal{S}</math>.
==Defintion of a simplicial complex==
A simplicial complex is a union of simplicies such that the intersection of any two simplicies is a simplex. Alternatively if <math>\mathcal{C}</math> is a simplicial complex then
1. Every face of a simplex in <math>\mathcal{C}</math> is a simplex in <math>\mathcal{C}</math>.
2. The intersection of two simplicies <math>A, B \in \mathcal{C}</math> is a face of both of A and B.
==Example==
The triangulation of a polygon in the plane is a simplcial complex. In fact it hints at the existance of simplicial complexes existing for all polytopes, e.g. every polyhedron can be expressed as tetrahedrons meeting full face to full face.
==Exercises== (under construction)
<noinclude> {{navigation|Book=Topology |current=Simplicial complexes |previous=Induced homomorphism |next=Barycentric coordinates}}
{{BookCat}} </noinclude>

<noinclude>
{{navigation|Book=Topology
|current=Morphisms
|previous=Vector Spaces
|next=Convexity}}
</noinclude>

In general, a ''morphism'' refers to a function mapping from one space to another that preserves structure. In terms of vector spaces the natural morphism is a ''linear map''.

==Linear maps==
{{TextBox|1=
;Definition of Linear Map:
A ''linear map'' is a function <math>f:V\to W</math> where <math>V, W</math> are vector spaces over a field F. Such that for all <math>v,w\in V</math>

1. <math>f(v+w)=f(v)+f(w)</math>

2. <math>f(\alpha v)=\alpha f(v)</math>

}}

The image of a linear map is a subspace of the domain. The kernel of a linear map is a subspace of the codomain.

==The Importance of Kernels and Images==

{{TextBox|1=
;Definition of Rank:
The ''rank'' of a linear map is the dimension of the image of the map <math>dim(Im(f))</math>. It also can be found using row reduction on the corresponding matrix.
}}

{{TextBox|1=
;Definition of Nullity:
The ''nullity'' of a linear map, or matrix, is the dimension of the kernel of the map <math>dim(Ker(f))</math>.
}}

{{TextBox|1=
;The Rank-Nullity Theorem:
For any linear map <math>f:V\to W</math>
:<math>dim(Ker(f))+dim(Im(f))=dim(V)</math>
}}

<noinclude>
{{navigation|Book=Topology
|current=Morphisms
|previous=Vector Spaces
|next=Convexity}}

{{BookCat}}
</noinclude>

revision.comment: genesis -- no frills copy draft and paste
revision.text:
Interim, Draft 2014-0226-01 to John Citron per request Draft (253 lines) posted 2014-0404 'as-is' on Trainz\Wikibook scratchpad page without any of the pending pen and ink edits, as need to link it today. <div style=TRS-style|S=12pt}}> GENERAL COMMENTS * GEN00.0 Consistant with the philosophy of "If-we-break-it, it's-our-job-to-really-fix-it" patches to update all CM's from TS2006-SP0 should be issued for all EXE or DLL re-issue fixable mode suggested hereinafter. * This is a moral obligation heretofore overlooked and ignored by N3V. People that are comfortable with a Trainz release should not have to suffer from a bad change inserted by coding changes or N3V's practices and data models. Realizing they are desiring to sell newer versions, breaking older status-quo ante behaviour is never ethical. You want sales, provide added value, not broken historic behavior. ** A prime example of this is CMP's original formulation to NOT report trainz-build tag values, as later CM's have and the concurrent BUG overlooked in each since, that of mishandling "Update available" by not discriminating with respect to Trainz-build tag values. This is a bona-fide BUG and N3V has a moral obligation to fix it. ** Similarly, KUID and KUID2 handling is mismanaged. Internally all the CMs ought be treating KUIDS as KUID2:xxx:yyy:0 as they indeed are evaluated. In practice, in operating CM, the two forms are not equal in searching, to the discomfiture of the customers. This means things are confusing, missed, overlooked and vexing. Having to 'Show Versions' to see alternative KUIDs is plainly deliterious to efficient user time investment and so forth. Searching <kuid:xxx:yyy> should expand to include all the <KUID2:xxx:yyy:nn> forms in the list resulting. Then OBSOLETE icons have context, the user can eliminate such. ** Related is the mishandling of the reports of updated kuids. MISSING DEPENDENCIES should not be showing obsoleted versions as a Missing dependency. THey aren't necessary so must not be shown as missing for it devalues the validity and utility of searching dependencies status icon (The yellow puzzle piece) ineffect trashing the users local database with FALSE and unhelpful information.
* GEN01.0 Programmers totally insensitive to aging problems. In particular eyesight.
* GEN01.a Ability to change skin and text color away from default is highly needed.
* GEN01.b An ability to modify skin+font size+font color+font face in CM, and font stuff in Surveyor would be REALLY REALLY valuable upgrade for us older and the visually impaired. Monitor+vid card configurations, dependent settings and such vary so much customer to customer that NOT having the flexibility means we tens-of-thousands're forced to make do with proofed displays vetted by the unaged and less debilitated.
* GEN01.c Particularly bad is the font size and coloration in TS12 Surveyor, especially SESSION EDIT WINDOW and the Mini Map gradiants' TS12 change from previous green to white font. (The latter clutters the screen with illegibility when labels are also on.
* GEN01.d Another color for trackside versus Scenery/Industry labels would be a nice option as well. Each of these should be customer settable for his own situation. 'Restore to Default' and Save Themes highly suggested accompanying changes... don't want disappearing print after all if someone misapplies an option.
* GEN02.0 Particularly bad is Session rules color schema. Black on current colors would be fine. Some idiot put white lettering on mostly grey backgrounds making text 'LOW CONTRAST' all-but-illegible with accompanied by the other stupid change... reducing the font sizes to ANT PRINT.
* GEN02.a RESTORE TRS2006 LOOK SEE AND FEEL.
* GEN02.b Trash any ant print in the programs.
* GEN02.c DEFAULT Min 'printers font size' (1 pt = 1/72nd inch) should be 10pt to 12pr for your actual user base AFTER monitor scaling. If the tools menu grows to take up the whole left margin, so be it. Straining to see/read something necessary is very frustrating and counter-productive and very deliterious to an enjoyable experience.
* GEN02.d Kids eyes can read large text fine, post 45 year-old eyes have adjustment issues young programmers need to be sensitive too. With a customization ability, the kids can select a smaller font at need.
* GEN02.e Regardless of settings, search window 'current line' should wrap to show whole titles of 'Username' data field.
* GEN03. Surveyor and Driver MAPS had nice legible green GRADIENT DATA... White in TS12 makes them blend into other data types messing with peoples' time who are trying to smooth terrain and appearance.
* GEN04. Loose a lot of time because Screen zooms or begins to zoom to medium elevation pseudo-flying-looking-down mode. THAT FOCAL TRIGGER ca 500-1000m too soon. Raise at least 300 meters. Current switch point is just about where one wants to tour a panarama of fixed layout.
* GEN05. Back in TRS2006... Elimination of TYPE and REGION tags manifesting in Surveyor tools was counterproductive. Breaking selectable sub-groups is opposite to the needs of users trying to remember how to find an single asset name to plop down. Pick list doesn't cut it with Category-Class filtering alone -- Dataset should allow user understanding to subcategorize such groupings. WHAT IS NEEDED is ability to allow USERS to override AUTHORS and edit those tags in both Surveyor, viewer and pick APPS and at the very least from CM--without a need to manually open config.txt and edit... CM should allow various adjustments in other words using popup APIs while maintaining CURRENT SEARCH.
* GEN06. History of Current Search and last selections too short in real life error fixing. Consider some specific search which then shows assets with missing dependancies. Now need to change screen to display for assets to see the missing asssets (second screen) so can evaluate versions and/or reported errors and warnings and so forth. Any one asset examination may lead to another search, so third is used. Resolving that, usually means importing or DLS machinations... usually involving a fourth screen. The ORIGINAL TASK you were about is now almost always gone... so if you didn't manually save that search you are screwed again by the programmers doing coding on the cheap and convenient for them, not software crafted to the users common needs.
* GEN07. KUID2 version assets should not generate a missing dependancy puzzle piece when the prior assets are not present. If five failed and the sixth trial works, ':5' version is all that matters INCLUDING WHENEVER something else is referencing an earlier version. (Logically, the CM data base may want to track the substitute, but CM should not be written to bother humans about an earlier missing version, unless parts of it are needed by reference. In that case, Trainz should create a whole corrected asset and kill the earlier versions itself.
* GEN08. BADLY need data search range and especially a date range abilty in CM, we humans work in spurts, recall by association, and frequently work past one days end (MIDNIGHT... during scarce and valuable 'HOBBY TIME') and the beginning of the next... or over several groups of days, our highly constrained time permitting. Selecting individual days with ANDs is tedious to say the least, and worst, cannot be saved. (the dates aren't saved but normalise to 'today'.)
* GEN08b. Allow dates in search pane as saved criteria in CM, and it's seatrch tabs
* GEN08c. Some wildcarding in search parameters would be greatly appreciated. Especially at least a two field search with wilddards in between. Tektronics or possibly DEC once had a beautiful command line search which would be good. '/tag1/*/tag2/' was better than a regex for finding variable length terms. Some regex could be built in as well. '//Ctag1Ctag2C*' (or '//Ctag1CC*tag2C' as an alternive to the first example) would enable the delimiter to subst so that character would be the new escaped delimiter... what ever the character might be.
* GEN08d-1. DOUBLE escape after a space following a valid find string would have the last part be a substitution string. THAT required a second escape character which was usually the '$' IIRC. Thus '/tag1/*/$tag2$/ /$replacement$/' would replace 'tag2' and similarly, '/tag1/*/$*$//tag2/ /$insert_this$/ would split and insert the term. Also used were # for a digit, ? for a single char and '^nn' to repeat a type so ?^15 would count fifteen anycharacters, whilst #^(2-7) allowed for variable number digit sequences, which would include both decimal points, scientific notation (-1.5408E-04) and signs if necessary in such.
* GEN08d2. Given such tooling, would like to have RENAMING on the fly inside CM, even Surveyor... some way to locally change the term string of an asset (username). Could be implemented as an alias term CM inserts into the config.
* GEN09. Along similar lines, adding a revisions and notes tag in the config would be very welcome the revisions field would display as an header prefixing the asset description data and the notes as an addendum suffixing the asset description data.
* GEN10. Those three and the trainz-build codes need be viewable in an auxillary window in surveyor... Said content display window would change when the selected item is accessed in the surveyor tools tabs. The user would toggle it open and closed with a hotkey toggle and/or close button.
* GEN09.a Need to self-identify which asset is list of errors and warnings in titlebars
* GEN09.b IMPORT .cdp and Content... 'TASK COMPLETED' 'DETAILS' messages should pair both asset names and kuids (ALWAYS ACTUALLY) This was unhelpful results: Message: Will install content package "F:\CDP files\All_TS12_CDPs\Scenery Trainz.cdp" Message: Will install content package "F:\CDP files\All_TS12_CDPs\TransDEM Ground Textures V3.cdp" Message: Will install content package "F:\CDP files\All_TS12_CDPs\US&S Style B Semaphore Pack.cdp" Warning: Skipped previously installed asset '0-4-0T Jay Street Connecting #1 --- Scenery' ... SNIP, SNIP ... Warning: Skipped previously installed asset 'Streetcar Peter Witt --- Scenery' Warning: Skipped previously installed asset 'TransDEM20 00' Warning: Skipped previously installed asset 'TransDEM20 01' ... SNIP, SNIP ... Warning: Skipped previously installed asset 'TransDEM20 18' Warning: Skipped previously installed asset 'TransDEM20 19' Warning: Skipped previously installed asset 'US&S Style-B 04 Home/Distant Semaphore TS2012' ... SNIP, SNIP ... Warning: Skipped previously installed asset 'US&S Style-B 03L Distant/Distant Semaphore TS2012' Warning: Skipped previously installed asset 'US&S Style-B Semaphore Numbers' Warning: Skipped previously installed asset 'US&S Style B Semaphore Mesh Library' ...
* GEN09c) Would actually be quite handy to have these screens have a kuid stream output, a comma separated list of the kuids listed in the message. Something we can paste in (including unknown location Kuids) into the search window or capture to a text file to later pursue missing assets. As is, we have to go through several other screens to capture dependencies which are unknown location (missing, not on DLS nor local).
09d) Several different output arrangements by click box selection would be nice
09e) [CTRL]-[A] + [CTRL]-[C} needs to work on all these message boxs and APIs. Default should then list both kuids and names with messages. Excepting error and warnings report... which should have those indentifiers in the tit6le bar... solutions sometimes take a while to research... other things demand attention, so having pairing with folders open for edit and a results window... is far more efficient than guessing!
10. Programmers need to use unique names for executables Windows finds out about. The overuse of Trainz.exe (one in bin one as launcher from installation's root) is confusing at best. Worse still is no distinction between versions in name for those who operate multiple Trainz legacy varieties too. Poor practice in any event given stand-alone nature of evolving product.
* GEN11.0 Task complete message windows, and all popup windows in general: assaying extent of errors frequently has 3-5 open at once to see where same error by same author is occuring. Need to self-identify which asset is list of errors and warnings in titlebars. Further, if possible a different icon in Windows 'open processes' (Taskbars tabs) would be valuable, at LEAST one different from CM and another different for TADdaemon (if visible).
Main Menu wishlist 01a. Author column of Routes and Sessions
01b. Title bar show folder pathspec and trainz-build
02a. Columns listing Last ALTERED date and last access date
02b. and kuids (All optional toggle or click box or drop down selectable)
03. MAIN MENU -- RESUME historic behavior of positioning list menu to last loaded route and session, or at least display what it was. (Prefer the TS2009-TRS2004 historic menu overall)
04. MAIN MENU -- 'Navigation Action buttons' at or near top (Like browsers), not down at screen bottom nor any at right and left... launch interface frankly sucks.
COM05.0 CM+SUR -- Desire Two run-time EDITABLE USER 'AUX-DESCRIPTIONs fields' that individual users can add and edit in both CM and Surveyor, adding that capability to viewer mode asset browsers like Railyard and the proposed 'Trackside" (or what ever name is given the general asset viewer(s). These should be click-box activated or disabled to see only the description (default) or any combo of the three.
COM05.a New Tag "Aux-description1" would prefix in CM and any in surveyor pop-up description view (Suggested else where in detail).
COM05.b Whilst tag "Aux-description2" or "Revisions-record" would append to current string when things display, if enabled. (I'd use this to display a change record, of modified assets. (e.g. Date, installed newer data structures and thumbnails, deleted obsolescent tags 'region', 'type' 'asset-filename', [Or whatever] and advanced Kuid to Kuid2 and trainz-build to V2.6 ,[Or whatever]. This latter could and should be handled in a remarks header block as a file header ID.
06. Ability to search keywords or string in both CM and Surveyor DESCRIPTION FIELDS... including proposed 'Aux-description' augmentations. [Like all good coding, where necessary legacy Trainz releases should have a Patch to ignore such new data and data formats. The same patch project should be used to fix the various CMs so that they all (TRS2006, TC1&2, TC3...) ignore versions currently listed as AVAILABLE UPDATES when in fact those are in data formats incompatible with earlier Trainz. (i.e. BUG IN CM programming: Assets to build v3.7 should NOT be reported as available in TS10 etc. Assets to 3.0 should not be reported as Out of Date in TC3, and its predecessors.)
SURVEYOR NEEDS and shortcomings... * SUR01. NEW TOOL BUTTON==Need ability to set numeric height and rotation on F3-O scenery objects; sometimes things manifest with slight offset angle that cannot be eliminated, ditto elevation differential making it impossible to blend two or more into one displayed entity/virtual object.
* SUR02. NEW TOOL BUTTON==Need ability to set a fixed (default) angle of F3-O scenery items in put down. (e.g. all the houses in a row development parrallel to a street oriented at compass 323 or 45 or 165 degrees...) THis means the auto-rotation setting in OPTIONS needs local override toggle and data input. USE THE SPACE wasted currently by "Advanced Tools" (WHAT A CROCK OF...) expanders...
* SUR03. Pick list needs to respond to tool activated so only F3 items are in when tool active, so only F4-Y objects (trackside) show when that tool selected, etc.
* SUR04. Need to be able to save and import nn+1 pick list(s) -- users names and options (...\Settings\picks\*.txt suggested)
* SUR05. Get tools inconsistent -- all should stay in get mode until A for Add hotkey pressed.
* SUR06. TEXTURE TOOL needs overhauled so selected texture name/title of texture appears in edit line.
* SUR07. Elevation back away 'zoom to map mode' needs switching-point trigger capability to be set by user or raised at least 1000 feet above current trigger point, and THAT VALUE should be the default for user set point when fixed. [High priority--this is costing lots of lost time in undesired focal shifts.]
* SUR08. BADLY NEED hot key for 'View errors and warnings'.
* SUR09. Changing of perspective by slight zoom back to see wider panorama/view is very annoying -- 3x out of four imposes a long delay... [suspect presumably because of LOD meshes???]
* SUR10. Would like a hotkey to set angle of view relative to horizon when viewing obliquely downwards and 'flying' above terrain. Mounse rolls too far, too frequently stopping on either side of best angle as wanted.
* SUR11.a Eliminating Objects subgrouping type control in surveyor a bad mistake. Industries vs buildings etc. had a filtering and location ability that was very useful. Far more useful than huge list format now in TS12.
* SUR11.b New Feature very much desired: HOTKEY ability to toggle widening of tool menu displays so can read the whole title of items.
* SUR12. Wanted: Global GET TOOL - Press hotkey then clickon whatever, gives the proper tool tab, then KUID under mouse tool tip.
* SUR13. If tab is active, any get key should open tab and display the get... not waste users time.
* SUR14. Railyard spinoff-allow viewing of F3-O objects and preferrably also F3-S, F4-Y, F2 textures, ideally in popup from in CM like viewing the config.txt file.
* SUR15. TOOL API's and Pick List, etc... popup items using up screen space including mini-map should be dragable to second or third head monitors AND ALSO RESIZABLE!
* SUR16. CLICK BUTTON IN SURVEYOR AND CM to 'UNFAVORITE' an asset... i.e. NEVER SHOW ME THIS ITEM AGAIN in Surveyor (e.g. Flip Trees in a Speedtreed route, BR rollng stock in US etc.) Whether this is same as disabling the item in CM or archiving it, or some third mode, don't care. Disabling seems about right, but in CM would LOVE TO HIDE THOSE THINGS TOO!
* SUR17. WANT A 'PICK LIST OF (adjustment) TOOL BUTTONS' w/data seeting input fields, perhaps on F8?
* SUR18. GET TOOLS MUST STOP DEFAULTING to ADD. I can hit the 'A' hotkey myself.
* SUR19. Surveyor ability to toggle sounds on and off whilst working an area would be nice. Got a wolf right where I need to do a lot more development ... that really annoys the wife and me!
* SUR20. Compass rose added in the Trainz Classics in the exactly worst place on the minimap for those of us using one monitor more often than not. THAT MODE requires a small mini map extended off the screen lower left corner... making the compass rose overtop some very valuable views... near center screen, where the mouse moves the screen/angle and keys rotate the view.
* SUR21. 'Circumstansial Selectable Pick groups' ... Seperate Pick List both by type and some user definable groups activated by 'click buttons'... trying to just pick textures they are mixed with other things really slowing down the utility of Pick list. IF "Bookmarks buttons" had a second row coresponding to other pick lists, all savable and transportable route to route, etc. (Export should be an external and EDITABLE comma delimited multiline TXT file enabling users to copy, edit, or archive! 'Input' and 'save as' and 'merge with' file at some path specified too. Extracting a portion ('Export Part As...' and saving as would be nice but not necessary feature.)
* SUR22. LIST ABILITY of Asset type X "In this Route"... for example... list all textures on ground used so far on this route and put them in a pick list type display applett.
* SUR23. Asset choosing tools should allow description in Surveyor mode in an optional pop-up screen. Popup concieved to be an extension of current tool set and applies solely to selected asset. Scrolling through those scrolls the descritions in the new popup enhanced.
content manager punchlist * CMn0.0 [partial repeat-see whole in General comments] Consistant with the philosophy of "If-we-break-it, it's-our-job-to-really-fix-it" patches to update all CM's from TS2006-SP0 should be issued for all EXE or DLL re-issue fixable mode suggested hereinafter. A prime example of this is CMP's original formulation to NOT report trainz-build tag values, as later CM's have and the concurrent BUG overlooked in each since, that of mishandling "Update available" by not discriminating with respect to Trainz-build tag values.
* CMn01. Errors are so prevalent, need View Errors and Warnings API in title bar to give title of asset being reported. In the real world, we have no choice but to chase more than one error at a time now and then. [Very High Priority]
* CMn02. <kuid:-10:197>
* CMn03. CM BADLY NEEDS WEB type interface so pervasive nowadays to backspace to previous search, and such searches as are kept in que, needs much longer length. Four just isn't enough and eight might not be either. 16 would be more than enough in any circumstance I could keep straight. Bumping off listed items in searches list would be a good feature to have, suggest drag and toss feature.
* CMn04. DUP 14 above: Railyard spinoff-allow viewing of F3-O objects and preferrably also F3-S, F4-Y, F2 textures, ideally in popup from in CM like viewing the config.txt file.
* CMn05. Ability to save download que, set it aside and prioritize a different DLS list first. reboot Trainz or computer or in any event return to it or any other saved list at a later time more convenient to the user.
* CMn06. Listing ability of stuff in Download helper
* CMn07. Expand codes for category region to indlude continental expanses, e.g. Mexico, US+ Canada find much in the way of identical rolling stock types.
* CMn08. Capture current search/main list to savable kuid list (Text file will do fine, best if search then allowe import of same. Manual cut and paste fine too for me.)
* CMn09. Asset Description to be 1st item, then screenshot in ASSET DETAILS pane * CMn10. CLICK BOX on SEARCH PANE to disable including DLS and Local and Built In items selectively. Setting three criteria (Name_+AND NOT+ON DOWNLOAD STN is time disrespectful. NEED TOO OFTEN.
* CMn11. Boolean search params... move to top of list, or preferably loose and replace with click-box implementation where the clickbox applies to the next search field following. Rearranging search to a top bar would be advisable--the left panes are overly busy and overworked.
* CMn12. Along the same lines revising the 'Asset Details' pane to a relocatable resizable window format [or this older (option selectable) placement] would be good. Description and screenshot are most important, so current placement as bottom items is contraindicated.
* CMn13. Finding a list of KUIDs comes up as obsoletes, when should default to showing current kuid installed and active if that's suplanting it. CHANGE THE FONT COLOR AT LEAST SHOWING the little OBSOLETE iconography means the asset is coming up obsolete when it's the only version still to be found. (May be a circumstance with new kuid obsoleting an updated one. Seen in SS Log Dump Diesel, misstated: <kuid2:86661:144048:2> (replacement) vs. <kuid:86661:144012>, the first has the 2nd in obsolete table. BOTH were in data base. Having the disposihle one come up in red font would let people know is deletable asset. Generated errors in newer Trainz apparently. Part of Northbay County routes. )
* CMn14.0 Need a right Click Copy KUIDS ONLY for CM Main Display items. Sometimes want just a comma separated list, for example to search another Trainz's CM for said assets.
* CMn15.0 CURRENT SEARCH 'Tab' should return user to the prior search selected by the main search tool in the left CM/CMP Pane -- not OVERRIGHT THAT with the results of clicking "VIEW IN MAIN LIST", or any of it's derived subsequent Show Dependencies applets.
* CMn15.a THIS IS AN URGENT CHANGE NEED that would greatly aid user productivity and experiences with Trainz--downloading many assets, especially routes and sessions, often returns a large "PUNCH LIST" of further items that need to be downloaded.
* CMn15.b The ONLY way to currently capture and enter these into the Download Helper pane is to SHOW IN MAIN LIST... then drag and drop -- messing up a larger work process and interfering with ongoing project tasks (INTERUPTIONS SUCK). VERY VEXING.
* CMn15.c Recommend: Adding clidk box "ADD Updates and missing dependencies to the Show Dependencies applet. One click adds any updated or missing dependency available on the DLS to the CM DOWNLOAD HELPER PANE.
* CMn15.d Further, missing dependencies NOT ON THE DLS ought to append a log file as follows: ** ''Timestamp, Datestamp, TRAINZ ASSET: ::: 'JRPX 20800 gal tank car', <kuid2:45324:300008:2> missing the following non-DLS assets: ::: Unknown Location: <kuid2:45324:28900:1> ::: Unknown Location: <kuid2:45324:50203:1> ::: Unknown Location: <kuid2:45324:555200:1> :::: <kuid2:45324:300008:2> needs: <kuid2:45324:28900:1>,<kuid2:45324:50203:1>,<kuid2:45324:555200:1>
:: END: 'JRPX 20800 gal tank car'
* CMn16.0 HOTKEY and/or menubar toggle between Large and Small Icons. - Really need a Medium size, small icons can't be made out, but that's best for maximizing data listed seen. LARGE for figuring out the status. A blend of the two would be greatly appreciated. Hence a rotating toggle would work.
* CMn17.0 CMs occasionally get display all bolloxed up, so Settings click box to reinitialize display (as when starting up) would cut down on the quitting our and relaunching (and reduce frustration because of interupted thought process, work in prograss.)
* CMn18.0 IMPORTING CDPs... The Task COmplete popup needs the STANDARD show in 'Main View' option button even for case when ALL ASSETS SKIPPED because already present. And the default behavior should be to show all in the CDP when so viewing a mixed bag of imports and skipped. AT THE LEAST this would help us better organize and label collected CDPs without resorting to pasting the names in and then one by one searching what the heck was there and came in (or was present in the cdp).
* CMn19.0 CDP Preview read and display needed, not a base import, but data to decide if import is GOOD... Kuids list, Names, Trainz-build at a mininum. Option to VIEW in MAIN SCREEN and if there, check the lot for updates on the DLS (Versions listed for each, in other words)
* CMn20.0 Importing CDPs or otherwise, View in Main List needs to display the UNKNOWN KUIDs in the same list so we can at least get the picture of how much we're screwed by downloading that route or session... If CM could manage a running list of missing assets we can get as a text report file, that would be a great time saving feature.
* CMn21.0 Selecting a batch (Screenful) of assets and lauching view Versions, needs allow a cut and paste save at least for missing (ny definintion UNKNOWN to the DLS) assets.
* CMn22.0 Task Complete popups universally need report which version in reporting CM output results, with TADdaemon running 3 CMs at once and cross loading assets has been a frequent experience this past week.
* CMn23.0 Having the registry entry for CPS track various installations and ask which Trainz to launch/load them into would be a nice safeguard. An accidental click had TRS2006 importing TS09--TS12 data yesterday...
* CMn24.0 INSTALL A THUMNAIL AUTOMATICALLY feature. A) adapt Railyard to show any asset. The software ia already present in surveyor ot generate the rotating images... adapt so ** CMn24.a Scenery ([f3]-[O] selections and many [f4]-[Y] assets can be viewed in a standard Trainz board with some default setups of terrain based on size of the asset generated geometry (tiny, small, medium, large corresponding to a road sign/trackside small footprint asset, house size, commercial building size, Factory/Level Bridges assets with ample lengths). Each of those can be placed in a locus a fixed radial distance from the (focal length) virtual camera, the object virtually rotated to maximize width aspect, and if rectangular camera position automatically precessed around (i.e. to show two building faces) and canted (move camera up to tree top height) to establish a perspective view. SNAP SNAP. AUTO EDIT the configs.
* CMn25.0 Task complete message windows, and all popup windows in general: assaying extent of errors frequently has 3-5 open at once to see where same error by same author is occuring. Need to self-identify which asset is list of errors and warnings in titlebars. Further, if possible a different icon in Windows 'open processes' (Taskbars tabs) would be valuable, at LEAST one different from CM and another different for TADdaemon (if visible).
* CMn26.0 Ordering of items in Search drop down needs refactored to place those needed most often up the top, AND and OR, NAME, AUTHOR, KUID, immediately come to mind as do local, DLS and installed. Category should be just after booleans.
* CMn27.0 Displaying a list of assets in such and such should not loose the current search. Further, especially should have search combo's in search pane listed over list of kuids. Even going one page past, measn guessing on what resulted 3-30 minutes ago. Mostly I miss finding my way back. More history would be best, preferrably like a Broswer history of at least 16 items in drop down form, most recent top to bottom. Date installed, Date modified, era, region at bottom. Alternatively this order and alphabetical with click box toggle.
zzz DRIVER SHORTCOMINGS * DVR01. Font size on Driver Map is about 2 pt too small for older viewers. Desire a menu option to select larger sizes from this default as the new minimum of a set of selectable font scales. * DVR02. Repeat above for default font size in HTML pop-up Windows
* DVR03. TS12 switch to white on other white lettering Gradients data is HIGHLY problematic. GIVE US GREEN AGAIN Please. Having another text color for some frequent assets would also be handy-suggest yellow for junction names and a seperate toggle to hide those labels or the Red-Green controls which can overwhelm accessing the data one actually needs when trying to get an overview of upcoming tracks and yards. Need to process junctions follows after getting a sense of what is needed.
* DVR04.0
* DVR05.0
* DVR06.0
* DVR07.0
* DVR08.0
-- The_End_File for now -- </div>

The Cantor space is a generalisation of the Cantor set, which can be seen as any element as the homeomorphism class of the Cantor set defined below.
==Definition of the Cantor set==
The Cantor set is the limit of an infinite process of removing subsets of the unit interval depicted here. [[Image:Cantor set in seven iterations.svg|729px|Cantor ternary set, in seven iterations]]
So at any given step we remove the middle thirds of the unit interval, let <math>C_0=[0,1]</math> so at the n-th step we have:
:<math>C_n=\frac{C_{n-1}}{3}\cup \big(\frac{2}{3}+\frac{C_{n-1}}{3}\big)</math>
So the effect is scaling the previous step down by a third and putting two copies next to each other. Then the Cantor set is
:<math>C=\bigcap_{i=0}^{\infty} C_i</math>
==Definition of the Cantor space==
A Cantor space is any space homeomorphically equivalent to <math>C</math> defined above. The value of this defintion is elucidated by the following theorem.
==Brouwer's Theorem==
An equivalent form of Brouwer's original theorem is: "A topological space is a Cantor space if and only if it is non-empty, perfect, compact, totally disconnected, and metrizable."
To understand this let's fill in the definition not yet covered.
1. Clearly, non-empty means it is not the empty set.
2. Perfect means the space has no isolated points (no points that are contained in an open set in the ambient space).
3. Compactness has been covered.
4. Totally disconnected means the connected components (the maximal connected subsets) of the space are all points.
5. Metrisable means there exists a metric for this space.
Thus the theorem states that the combination of these conditions leaves a space homeomorphic to the Cantor set.
==Example==
Consider the map from the set of infinite binary codes <math>\{0,1\}^\mathbb{N}</math> often written <math>2^\mathbb{N}</math> to the Cantor set defined above: <math>f:2^\mathbb{N}\to C</math> defined as for a sequence <math>a=(a_i)_{i=0}^{\infty}</math>
:<math>f(a)=\sum_{i=0}^{\infty}\frac{2a_i}{3^{i+1}}</math>
Then f is a homeomorphism of metric spaces, meaning that all the properties above hold for the space <math>2^\mathbb{N}</math>.

page.title: International Postage Meter Stamp Catalog/Western Sahara

revision.text:
=Western Sahara=
*Western Sahara is a territory that issued adhesive postage stamps during the period of Spanish occupation (until 1975) and later, after 1980, by Morocco after it gained control of the territory. * Meter stamps have not been seen or reported from either administration.
----

<center> <big><big><big>Les 21 ~ Lesson 21</big></big></big>
<big>That difficult word order...</big> </center> ---- <small><< [[Dutch/Lesson 20|Les 20]] | </small>'''Les 21''' ----
==Issues==
Word order in Dutch is not easy for speakers of English or one of the Romance languages. We have already seen a number of issues above that may well drive Anglophone learners of Dutch a little crazy. The three main ones are:
#Inversion: reversing the order of the subject and the finite verb (See [[Dutch/Lesson 11|Lesson 11]]) #Subjunction: a different word order in a dependent clause (See [[Dutch/Lesson 11|Lesson 11]]) #Separability: separable verbs can split and combine (See [[Dutch/Lesson 18|Lesson 18]])
These three issues are mainly concerned with the verbs in the sentence.
However, pronominal adverbs are also separable (See [[Dutch/Lesson 8|Lesson 8]]) and this is part of a more general, fourth issue: the position of other parts of the sentence, like adverbial expressions or objects. It is also different from English.
Obviously in a Dutch sentence these four issues may very well combine and interfere with each other.
This lesson will try to tie the issues together a bit and expand on the fourth issue.
===Two poles===
In English a sentence typically has a basic <font color="blue">S</font><font color="red">V</font><font color="green">O</font> structure: <font color="blue">subject</font> - <font color="red">verb</font> - <font color="green">object</font>
:E.g.: <font color="blue">The farmer</font> - <font color="red">plows</font> - <font color="green">the field</font>
Dutch has the same order in this case
:<font color="blue">De boer</font> - <font color="red">ploegt</font> - <font color="green">het veld</font>
But this resemblance is a bit deceptive. This becomes clear when we have a compound verb in the sentence. In English <font color="blue">S</font><font color="red">V</font><font color="green">O</font> continues to hold for the perfect tense for example:
:<font color="blue">The farmer</font> - <font color="red">has plowed</font> - <font color="green">the field</font>
But in Dutch this is ''not'' the case. The finite part of the verb 'has' - 'heeft' remains in the same position, but the participle 'geploegd' moves to end of the sentence, forming a second verbal pole:
: <font color="blue">De boer</font> - <font color="red">heeft</font> - <font color="green">het veld</font> - <font color="red">geploegd</font>
That means that Dutch is not really an <font color="blue">S</font><font color="red">V</font><font color="green">O</font> language. We could say that the Dutch structure has two verbal poles: <font color="blue">S</font><font color="red">V<sub>1</sub></font><font color="green">O</font><font color="red">V<sub>2</sub></font>
The second pole does not just attract past participles, but also infinitives, e.g. in the future tense
: <font color="blue">De boer</font> - <font color="red">zal</font> - <font color="green">het veld</font> - <font color="red">ploegen</font>
Also the adverbial prefix of a separable verb, like omhakken, moves to the second pole:
: <font color="blue">De boer</font> - <font color="red">hakt</font> - <font color="green">de boom</font> - <font color="red">om</font>
In a dependent clause the role of the second pole even becomes dominant, because even the finite verb moves to <font color="red">V<sub>2</sub></font>:
: Ik zeg dat <font color="blue">de boer</font> - <font color="green">het veld</font> - <font color="red">geploegd heeft</font> : Ik zeg dat <font color="blue">de boer</font> - <font color="green">het veld</font> - <font color="red">heeft geploegd</font>
(Both versions occur: Dutch word order is less uniform than the English one). In either case the order is <font color="blue">S</font><font color="green">O</font><font color="red">V</font>!
In English the order simply remains <font color="blue">S</font><font color="red">V</font><font color="green">O</font>:
:I say that <font color="blue">the farmer</font> - <font color="red">has plowed</font> - <font color="green">the field</font>
==Adverbs== Adverbial expressions typically end up ''between'' the two poles.
E.g. ''gisteren'' - ''yesterday''
:<font color="blue">De boer</font> - <font color="red">ploegde</font> -'''gisteren''' - <font color="green">het veld</font> :<font color="blue">De boer</font> - <font color="red">heeft</font> -'''gisteren''' - <font color="green">het veld</font> - <font color="red">geploegd</font> :Ik weet dat <font color="blue">de boer</font> -'''gisteren''' - <font color="green">het veld</font> - <font color="red">geploegd heeft</font>
Notice that in Dutch the adverbial expression typically comes ''before'' the object. It is possible to swap the object and the adverbial expression, -which resembles English word order more-, but this tends to put emphasis on the adverb:
:<font color="blue">De boer</font> - <font color="red">heeft</font> - <font color="green">het veld</font> -'''gísteren''' -<font color="red">geploegd</font> (niet: vandaag)
It also possible to put the adverbial expression up front, but then it triggers inversion of the subject and the finite verb:
:'''Gisteren''' - <font color="red">heeft</font> - <font color="blue">de boer</font> - <font color="green">het veld</font> -<font color="red">geploegd</font>
In the front position there is a mild emphasis on the adverb, but often it is just a way to accommodate more than one adverbial expression. Compare:
:<font color="blue">De boer</font> - <font color="red">heeft</font> -'''gisteren''' - '''met de tractor'''- <font color="green">het veld</font> - <font color="red">geploegd</font>
:'''Gisteren''' - <font color="red">heeft</font> - <font color="blue">de boer</font> - '''met de tractor''' - <font color="green">het veld</font> -<font color="red">geploegd</font>
The order of the adverbial expressions in usually '''when''' - '''how''' - '''where''': :<font color="blue">Ik</font>- <font color="red">ben</font> -'''gisteren''' - '''met de trein'''- '''naar Brussel''' - <font color="red">gereisd</font>
===niet=== Negation in Dutch is done by adding the adverb ''niet''. It gets its own position:
:<font color="blue">De boer</font> - <font color="red">ploegde</font> -'''gisteren''' - <font color="green">het veld</font> - '''niet''' :<font color="blue">De boer</font> - <font color="red">heeft</font> -'''gisteren''' - <font color="green">het veld</font> - '''niet''' - <font color="red">geploegd</font> :Ik weet dat <font color="blue">de boer</font> -'''gisteren''' - <font color="green">het veld</font> - '''niet''' - <font color="red">geploegd heeft</font>
We could put it before ''gisteren'', but that changes the meaning to: not yesterday (but today).
Sometimes, however, the negation is put between the adverbs, after the time expression:
The order of the adverbial expressions in usually '''when''' - '''how''' - '''where''': :<font color="blue">Ik</font>- <font color="red">ben</font> -'''gisteren''' - '''niet''' - '''met de trein'''- '''naar Brussel''' - <font color="red">gereisd</font>
==Objects: direct, indirect and prepositional== In Dutch the indirect object can be expression either with or without the preposition ''aan''. This is comparable to the situation in English:
:<font color="blue">He</font> <font color="red">gave</font> <font color="cyan">me</font> <font color="green">the book</font> :<font color="blue">He</font> <font color="red">gave</font> <font color="green">the book</font> <font color="cyan">to me</font>
:<font color="blue">Hij</font> <font color="red">gaf</font> <font color="cyan">mij</font> <font color="green">het boek</font> :<font color="blue">Hij</font> <font color="red">gaf</font> <font color="green">het boek</font> <font color="cyan">aan mij</font>
Notice that in both languages the real indirect object and its prepositional stand in have a different position in the sentence. This becomes clearer if we add some adverbial expressions to the Dutch sentences
:<font color="blue">Hij</font> <font color="red">gaf</font> <font color="cyan">mij</font> '''gisteren''' '''op straat''' <font color="green">het boek</font> :<font color="blue">Hij</font> <font color="red">gaf</font> '''gisteren''' '''op straat''' <font color="green">het boek</font> <font color="cyan">aan mij</font> :<font color="blue">Hij</font> <font color="red">heeft</font> '''gisteren''' '''op straat''' <font color="green">het boek</font> <font color="cyan">aan mij</font> <font color="red">gegeven</font>
Notice that the direct object gravitates towards the first pole. The prepositional version goes to the second.
We can swap most of the items in the sentence for emphasis, but not the indirect object one. Since Dutch has lost its case endings around 1600 in the spoken language there is only the word order to mark ''me'' as an indirect object.
In the written language there is exactly one exception: the third person plural (''them'') has two forms: hun for indirect objects and hen for direct and prepositional ones:
: Ik gaf hun het boek : Ik gaf het boek aan hen
However, this distinction was artificially created in the 1630's by a grammarian and despite four centuries of schoolmasters hammering it in, the artificial word 'hen' will seldom be heard in the spoken language.
==Prepositional objects and pronominal adverbs==
There are more prepositional objects in Dutch besides the one with 'aan'. Many verbs show fixed combination with certain prepositions, e.g.:
:Meewerken met iets :Deelnemen aan iets :Gebrand zijn op iets
:E.g.: Hij heeft <font color="green">aan deze wedstrijd</font> deelgenomen
When the noun 'wedstrijd' is to replaced by a pronoun, Dutch turns the prepositional object into a pronominal adverb:
: Hij heeft <font color="green">hieraan</font> deelgenomen
However, pronominal adverbs are separable and the locative part (er, hier, daar, waar) tends towards the first pole, whereas the prepositional one tends towards the second. This becomes apparent when we add adverbial expressions.
:Hij heeft '''vaak met volle overgave''' <font color="green">aan deze wedstrijd</font> deelgenomen : Hij heeft <font color="green">hier</font> '''vaak met volle overgave''' <font color="green">aan</font> deelgenomen

The Fool's Gold Loaf is a rather unusual sandwich, consisting of a whole french loaf filled with margarine, bacon, peanut butter and jelly. It is famous for being a favorite of Elvis Presley
== Ingredients == * 2 T [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] * 1 loaf French white [[Cookbook:Bread|bread]] * 1 lb / 450 g [[Cookbook:Bacon|bacon]] slices * 1 jar of smooth [[Cookbook:Peanut Butter|peanut butter]] * 1 jar of grape jelly (US), jam (UK)
== Procedure == # Preheat the oven to 350F/180C. Spread the margarine generously all over all sides of the loaf. Place it on a baking sheet in the oven. # Meanwhile, fry the bacon in a bit of oil until it is crisp and drain it thoroughly on paper towels. # Remove the loaf from the oven when it is evenly browned, after approximately 15 minutes. Slice the loaf lengthwise and hollow out the interior, leaving as much bread along the walls as desired. Slather a thick layer of peanut butter in the cavity of the loaf and follow with another thick layer of grape jelly. Use lots of both. # Arrange the bacon slices inside the cavity, or, if desired, layer the bacon slivers between the peanut butter and jelly. Close the loaf, slice and eat. Serves 8-10 for most people.
[[Category:Recipes]]

==Fixing the DLS, soonest!== This is a proposal to fix the issues with bad content on the DLS, which is not the bad data itself, but the bad data when downloaded. The solution is like exterminating other vermin, the quickest way is to remove their food supply, so to here I propose we remove the errors with automatic computer data shuffling. Here's the base N3V survival problem. The new user knows squat about fixing errors, or the perils of downloading a route. The secondary issue, is that those of us who do know that minefield still get stuck with the time-sink of fixing errors when assaying a new route. Since Many routes have dependencies with issues OR, those which have missing dependencies (''as bad to my thinking''), the goal is to deal with such ASAP as a community, and a corporate partner... {{TOCright}} So the strategy is to isolate those with issues, isolate the supporting cast of assets with issues, and isolate those which may have issues... leaving a set of clean problem free assets and routes on the new skinnier DLS that can be safely downloaded by even a third grader without much ado. THAT resultant will become the new default DLS on a diet. The other stages are user accessible web pages where one can shop and download knowing you may face a risk. In general, new users won't find out about those until they've been around long enough to not get discouraged. Lastly, I've a number of proposed methods for curing the new backlog, the assets with problems, the missing assets, and so forth. Again, I invoke computer automation with a little software assist from N3V. It's their mess, they benefit most from the attractiveness of the DLS. It's time they supported a system of expedited fixes. ==What are those== What are those other websites you ask, how will that work. Some may wonder if it will be expensive. (Compared to alienating customers? Just the opposite.) Well, simple, they're clones of [https://www.auran.com/TRS2004/DLS.php This TRS2004/DLS.php] website, just like a page such as [https://www.auran.com/TRS2004/DLS_viewasset.php?AssetID=193416 this snoop page] can be accessed. I presume they'd reside in another harddrive, possibly might need a separate computer, but we aren't talking a large outlay here, a few thousands in equipments should cover it with room to spare. The key difference is they will have a different URL, perhaps TRS2004/DLS-1.php, TRS2004/DLS-2.php, TRS2004/DLS-3.php or some more clever link namings. Whether they are organized as a sub-page, a permanent url, or whatnot I leave to the preferences of N3Vs webmaster and management. The point is there is little hardware and little software needed, there already exists a pipeline into the DLS for vetted and approved assets conformal to V2.9 or above. There already exists an link to the shopping carts in Simulator Central, and capacity to have that shopping cart trigger a download. Our only requirements in this specification are that # they duplicate the search capabilities of the TRS2004 DLS # They too can feed the shopping cart for download enqueuing ## --preferentially with a different background color to minimize confusion ## --they can transfer data to and fro to the other cloned DLS variants at need, ## or most importantly, via a channel with filtering supplied by the N3V programmers as discussed below. ==Homage== This 'naming' is a homage, a tribute to daytime children's programming when CABLE TV hadn't yet been invented. Don't know how international the [https://en.wikibooks.org/w/index.php?title=Special%3ASearch&search=Three+Stooges&go=Go Three Stooges reruns] were, but the FIVE-to-SEVEN stooges (They had some cast turn over in 45 years) were a vaudeville act gone to Movie Shorts and then Television shorts/programs and ran over four decades as a popular USA entertainment act. 'Larry' was wild haired and 'Curly' was Bald, while 'Moe' had a trademark bowl-snipped hairdo and sometimes sported a Hitleresque mustache but was always the boss except when they debuted in film with Shemp as the principal actor. Their skits relied heavily on abusing the others with eye-pokes and rump kicks, head-knocks and other slapstick comic stuff before society went over soft to the Nanny State motif. Their names are somewhat symbolic of stages in a process aimed to cleaning up the mess on the DLS... ''quickly'' ==Shemp== Shemp had an successful independent Hollywood and stage career and seen chronologically in their shorts output was a Curly replacement. (Actually Curly replaced Shemp initially—but he returned to the act over a decade later when brother Curly had a series of career and life-ending strokes) so because he's disorderly—with a hairdo from hell—we'll let him represent a clone of the current DLS, warts and all—with one important change: # '''SHEMP will not know what ''a 'simple KUID'''''' is but input the DLS as it is now—but as all as ALL KUID2 formats*... with any luck the software gurus will sense the obvious next nicety, a wildcard capability! # Shemp normally talks only to Curly, except for two highly constrained specific cases: ## unless Larry asks for something, ## or Moe tells him what to do. # Shemp will not output Class Y category-class assets, Maps, Scenarios, Sessions, except to Larry, but then if and only if Larry asks. # When told by Moe, Shemp will delete a map, session, or scenario. Moe does that only because he's received all the assets on the route, session, or scenario from Larry. {{bullR}}Signifies a complete ready to run session and route! Yea, team!{{bullR}}For those of you following, I sense you sensing that Moe will be holding the new DLS when this all works through. # When asked, Shemp will pass other assets to Curly, beginning with simplest most likely to be building block assets, then progressively higher organized kinds of assets. # then delete them when Curly says they're received and error checked. # Curly will not tell Shemp to delete assets with errors. Like sand running through an hour=glass, the implication here, good assets, once vetted (and the method assumes this will likely take some time) or repaired leave Curly and Shemp, and in the end, Shemp will end holding only routes with faulty content, Curly only faulty assets. {{text-box| :* Simple kuid's have outlived their usefulness, particularly as they confuse string searching. Since can be specified , both are redundant. Ironically, once everything is coded for kuid2 formats, I'd advocate (now that the statisticaly population is everything) converting all back to kuids, the 2 then being redundant. }} ==Curly== # Assume the next '''Curly''' is a website you can also stimulate into adding items into a shopping cart, which you can then download. Make the same assumption for each of the others... that downloading of a cart is already in place, n'est pas? Everyone thinking that five pages adding to same cart would overwhelm N3Vs technical capacity, please raise your hand. OK, Shane, you stay after school. ## Curly can not get any Sessions, scenarios, or Routes from Shemp, and when Shemp passes the assets on, he must delete them when curly tells him the Kuid2 is OKAY, leaving him holding only Sessions, Routes, and Scenarios--and assets with Errors... (like my CM!) # Meanwhile Curly tests the component assets in a prioritized scheme, based on category-class tags and KINDs from simplest to most complicated. More or less, I'd initially think to prioritize searching and input by: ## { G= Ground, E= Environment, J= Textures, H= meshes, I= Product, F= Foliage, O= Organisms, V= Vehicles, Z= Train Parts, M=Maintenance Of Way, W= Wayside, T=Track, S= Splines, B= Buildings, A= Motive Power, and rolling stock C,D,L,P,R,X } with a deliberate hold on Y= Maps and scenarios, sessions. ## All assets of '''{the set''': {{bullR }}'''Class "A" Motive Power''', Class "B" Buildings and Structure, {{Col |Class "C" Cabees,|blue}}{{bullR }} '''Class "D" Defence''', Class "E" Environment, {{Col |Class "F" Foliage,|blue}}{{bullR }} '''Class "G" Ground''', Class "H" Mes, {{Col |Class "I" Product,|blue}}{{bullR }} '''Class "J" Textures''', Class "L" Light Rail & Monorail, {{Col |Class "M" Maintenance Of Way,|blue}}{{bullR }} '''Class "O" Organisms''', Class "P" Passenger & Mail Car, {{Col |Class "R" Railcars & Multiple Unit Sets,|blue}}{{bullR }} '''Class "S" Splines''', Class "T" Track, {{Col |Class "V" Vehicle,|blue}}{{bullR }} '''Class "W" Wayside''', Class "X" Freight Car, {{Col |Class "Y" Maps and Scenario,|blue}}{{bullR }} '''Class "Z" Train Parts
}''' # Those which pass testing for TRS2006-SP1 (upto TC3--higher formats later by Larry) are copied and passed onto LARRY then... ## Curly then auto-modifies these substituting an annotation at the end of the description text ''"This asset auto-updated by DLS automation bot CURLY on 2014-0415, Happy Tax Day!'' and promoting the KUID2 to the next vacant level. That will usually be '+:1' so for oldest assets ( is the same as , lowest numbers most often, trainz-build tag to 2.6. Then passes those also onto Larry. ## That leaves Curly Holding a bag full of broken assets ## and assets with missing KUIDS (unbroken assets with missing dependencies)... Curly holds onto these until Larry asks for them. ==Larry== ;gets pre-vetted assets needing more TLC Larry is more clever than Curly as every fan knows. He's going to run the list of KUID2s from Curly and edit the files and folders of v2.6 to v2.8, translating data structures and tags, auto-annotating the description records ... making them TS2009 compliant (v2.9). Note, that if N4V wants to raise that v2.9 import threshold in the future, this facility will be in place. A little code tweak, and TANE compliant assets could in theory be produced sans our time being spent like our minutes are as cheap as raindrops in the Amazon during a thunderstorm. # The software for this is straight forward, for every migration N3V has made in the SIMPLER, OLDER data structures, they've made a more generalized more flexible analog, usually (ALMOST ALWAYS) using containers and/or texture.txt file expansions--EACH OF WHICH extended the flexibility and capabilities of optional asset behaviors. # Most of these can be defaulted by Larry as they do and have done for over a decade in their run time (read-in) code now. ## Since this is a pipeline translation, one approach would be to write filters, say five or six a day, old format to new (You know and I know they'll steal code from existing source files, so five a day isn't going to take very much of a chunk out of their schedules.), and run those against this DB until you've nothing left to convert. ### Filters for those unfamiliar with the concept are short programs using standard I/O facilities which can be 'piped' input to the previous output, and so on in a chain. ### Filters have been at the heart of Unix, sysix, linux, C, and even DOS and Window since the IBM PC debut stabilized the home computer market and overnight practically killed off most the operating systems competing with MSDOS (and eventually Windoze). ### Since you can chain them, you can also batch them, so bundle a set inside a batch file, selecting apropos sequences of filters to process this KIND of asset or that. ## Converted files are promoted with another KUID2 bump up and passed onto Moe, lucky bossy loud, Moe! ### One key to this is Moe continues the current vetting of assets to V2.9, whereas in this schema, the current DLS's clone )(SHEMP) would be able to resume accepting upgrades to assets by their own content creators to versions v2.6-v2.8; he passes them onto Curly, and an intermediate KUID (v2.0--V2.8) can resume being entered into the system. Thus partially updated assets can be pulled from our CMs and be fed to the rest of the community. Curly will need to read & run an CMP/TrainzUtil extract to vett for TRS2006-TC3 errors. ### Another asset upgrade schema in this thinking is a two way automatic data flow. LARRY requests an asset from his source Curly, but the asset Curly has, has a (potentially insoluable) problem (needing human intervention); meanwhile N3V sets it up so people volunteer and sign up and those accepting get a small add-on utility or patch from N3V which allows N3V to query for a locally modified kuid/asset. Curly initiates this process for when our volunteer's CM logs into the site and finds 3-5 users with the asset 'Locally Repaired' (and faultless!). ### The system reads three to five such from it's community partners via the tweaked TrainzUtil or whatnot program and compares the 3-5 excluding text babble lines to find three that are matches in the important data definition fields and subfolders. They don't even have to match in username tags--obsolescent tags are trimmed, Photos excluded, as are descriptions, licensing, and the other verbose text tags in the TrainzBaseSpec. A binary comparison finds three matches from community donors, and the asset is replace by the winner under the original name and description, licenses, company, et. al. In the event there is a disagreement (say a texture.txt file on one has an AlphaMask= set to a different state, the program would refer these 'fixed assets' to a human for selection of the best. # '''''Folks my brain is fried tonight''''', so this is the draft promised, albeit unfinished and lacking polish. You should get the gist by now. I'll see if I can finish this by tomorrow afternoon. N3V's in their weekend schedule so a day more won't slow anything down. // [[User:Fabartus|Fra]][[User talk:Fabartus|nkB]] 06:30, 5 April 2014 (UTC) ## When Larry's done with basic assets, the only thing left will be things he can't convert, so the humans will go back to write more filters. '''''Very futuristic''', eh... Men working for the computer taskmaster!'' # At some point though, the computer will be taken to task by the human slaves and told to start requesting routes from Shemp by starting with scenarios, then sessions, and working on dependent routes. ## Assets all accounted for, get passed to Moe as happy faces. ## Assets with errors get sent to CURLY! (He was feeling left out of the sessions and routes biz) ## Assets with missing dependencies make Larry Sad. He holds onto those, and from time to time checks against the input stream to see if there's news of a missing asset. ==MOE == ==Costs== Now for the price of a few url pages, and a few hard drives, this should be feasible using N3V's servers alone. The general scheme is to divide, conquer, and quarantine. Then update and userfy working content to new standards with apropos kuid advancements. Some 'asset validation' software will need to be customized by Windwalkr and company, but that should be mostly extracts from prior Trainz released make file resources (source code), and they'll have to work out piping data from server to server (I/O). Designate Curly to get Content with bad content (errors). Designate MOE to get all vetted and approved ERROR FREE content without missing dependencies ==End==

== Welcome! ==
[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, MisterRogors!
[[File:Crystal Clear app kedit.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for [[WB:AGF|collaborative]] development of free [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].''' You do not need technical skills to [[Using Wikibooks|contribute]]. You can [[WB:BOLD|easily change most books]]. Please [[WB:CHAT|introduce yourself]], and let us know what [[WB:PROJECTS|interests you]]. If you already contribute at other Wikimedia projects, our [[Wikibooks:Wikibooks for Wikimedians|Wikimedia Orientation]] should quickly get you started.
(Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?)
[[File:Icon apps query.svg|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Getting help'''
* Read the [[Using Wikibooks]] book for a friendly introduction to the project, or our [[Help:Contents|help pages]] for more information. * You can get friendly help from the community in the [[WB:HELP|user assistance room]] or our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * Upload freely licensed files to [[commons:Wikimedia Commons|Wikimedia Commons]]. You may [[WB:RFP|request permission]] to upload [[w:fair use|fair use]] files locally. Please include author and source {{tl|information}} and a {{nowrap|{{tl|non-free use rationale}}}} for [[WB:FU|non-free]] files.
[[File:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* You can [[WB:REVERT|restore]] a previously saved version. * Pages should follow the [[WB:NP|'''Book Title/Chapter Title''']] naming convention. * Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (is available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To request a page be deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason''}} to the top of the page. * Was a page you made deleted? Please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:RFD|RFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:RFU]], or ask the administrator who deleted the page.
[[File:Transmission icon.png|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please fill in [[WB:ES|the edit summary]] and [[WB:PREVIEW|preview]] your edits before saving. * Sign your name on [[WB:TALK|discussion pages]] by typing ~~~~ * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
Thanks, --[[User:Xania|ЗAНИA]] [[Image:Flag_of_Estonia.svg|15px]][[User talk:Xania|talk]] 05:50, 5 April 2014 (UTC)

This book is about OpenMP, a language extension to C (and C++) that allows for easy parallel programming. To understand what OpenMP makes possible, it is first important to know what parallel programming is and what it isn't.
''[[:w:en:Parallel computing|Parallel programming]]'' means writing software that operates on several compute devices at the same time. For the purpose of this book, a "compute device" is primarily a processor (CPU) or a processor core within a multicore CPU, which is the focus of OpenMP 3. In other settings, a compute device may mean a full-blown computer within a cluster of computers, or a different type of device such as a graphic processing unit (GPU). An extension of OpenMP to cluster computing has been devised by Intel, and OpenMP 4 adds supports for executing code on non-CPU devices, but these are outside the scope of this book.
Parallel programming is mainly done to speed up computations that have to be fast. Ideally, if you have ''n'' compute devices (cores) to run a program, you'd want the program to be ''n'' times as fast as when it runs on a single device. This ideal situation never occurs in practice because the compute devices need to communicate with each other, sending and waiting for messages such as "give me the result of your computation". Still, parallel programming can speed up many applications.
Parallel programming should be distinguished from ''[[:w:en:Concurrent computing|concurrent programming]]'', which means breaking down a program into processes that conceptually run at the same time. There is considerable overlap between parallel and concurrent programs: both involve decomposing a task into distinct subtasks that can be executed separately, and concurrent programs can benefit from having their tasks run on multiple compute devices in parallel. However, full concurrent programming is a different art from that of parallel programming in that usually, different types of communication occur between concurrent tasks than between parallel tasks. <!-- example of concurrent programming needed -->
OpenMP adds support for parallel programming to C in a very clean way. Unlike thread libraries, little change is needed to existing programs to have them run on multiple processors in parallel. In fact, the basic constructs of OpenMP are so non-intrusive that programs using them but compiled by a compiler that doesn't support OpenMP will still work (although sequentially, of course). To see what that means, consider the following C function:
<source lang="c"> void broadcast_sin(double *a, size_t n) { #pragma omp parallel for for (size_t i = 0; i < n; i++) { a[i] = sin(a[i]); } } </source>
This function "broadcasts" the sine function over an array, storing its results back into that same array. When OpenMP is enabled in the compiler, it will in fact do so using multiple threads, but without OpenMP, it will still function and produce the exact same effect.
[[Image:Fork join.svg|thumb|right|400px|Illustration of the fork–join model: the program splits ("forks") into sections that are executed in parallel and join into a sequential section when done. This occurs multiple times over the lifetime of the program.]] OpenMP programs work according to a so-called [[:w:en:Fork–join model|fork–join model]], illustrated on the right. The OpenMP runtime maintains a thread pool, and every time a parallel section is encountered, it distributes work over the threads in the pool. When all threads are done, sequential execution is resumed.
